pros: Very friendly staff and nice location. Breakfast was good too. cons: Smell of the room was a bit muddy and compared to other older buildings we have stayed in on our vacation in Portugal they could renovate the rooms.

pros: Place is wonderful atmospheric. 
Breakfast is very good apart of the coffee which is horrible . Doesn't matter from the machine or "fresh brewed" ? cons: The coffee
Price/value ? But you pay for the ambiente
pros: Great position cons: The bar area
pros: Beautiful old convent at a great location the rooms were nice and the breakfast was really great! cons: The bar
pros: A beautiful place to stay and very central.  Breakfast exceeded expectations. cons: A little more heating in the public areas as it was quite a cold night!
pros: The location was excellent and the staff were friendly and polite had a nice meal but it was slightly over priced our suite was very nice and overall we had a great experience cons:

pros: The warm welcome at reception. The beautiful courtyard of the convent so tranquil. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. We enjoyed a tasty evening meal in the restaurant. The pork ribs pork belly and the fish..sea bass were all delicious. We really enjoyed our stay. cons:

pros: This is a magnificent place to stay in the heart of old Tavira full of history and with a relaxing atmosphere. The location is perfect. The staff are very welcoming and the service is impeccable. Our room was spacious and the bed very comfortable with a large bathroom and plenty of storage. The lavish buffet breakfasts are exceptional with everything you could want and more the best we've experienced anywhere. Altogether a very special few days. cons: A few small things. 
We're puzzled by the uncharacteristic meanness of providing only four teas and coffees in the room and then charging for extras. Strange when everything else is so generous.
A small personal gripe (common to many hotels) - the room was dimly lit and we found it difficult to read at night. Bedside reading lights would be welcome.
Also a second comfortable chair in the room would be welcome - there's plenty of space.
pros: Breakfast was amazing - even champagne on offer. cons: Lighter bedclothes - the duvet was a heavy feather one
pros: Atmos aesthetics history and do so relaxing cons: Nothing
pros: The rooms are beautiful great food and lovely staff made for a very enjoyable break. The history talk and tour of the pousada with a young local historian was a particular highlight. cons:
pros: The peaceful relaxing atmosphere of the hotel cons: Air Con was not great but we lived with it
pros: Great location very interesting building and a very informative tour with historical information about the building and city. cons:
pros: Fantastic welcoming staff cons: Nothing was an issue
pros: Splendid location within the medieval town walls and adjacent to historic churches. A lovely old building! cons:

pros: The breakfast was great with a wide choice.
The location was great and walkable to all the important sites in town. cons:

pros: Room was very modern spacious clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was substantial and tasty. cons: A bit too much hallway noise. Normally I dampen that out by running the air conditioning in fan only mode but in this case you can only run the fan if the heat is on.

pros: Location is right in the centre of Tavira.
Rooms are quiet and spacious. cons: Nothing.

pros: Location and facilities were excellent!! cons: We stayed on the night of the holiday party.  There were only a few people staying as it was off season. For some STRANGE reason they put us in a room at the very end of the facility.  At 2 am we were woken up by LOUD yelling and partying and slamming of doors and windows right NEXT to our room!! Finally I has to call front desk at 3 am and ask why they would put people obviously at the hotel party RIGHT NEXT  to our room knowing that their were at LEAST 75 rooms available!!! Needless to say we did not get much sleep but they did have the party next door move to a different room!!  So...what I did not like is that the front staff did not put much thought into where they were having guests stay for the night!!! Why on EARTH would they put them right next to our room!!! that is the million dollar question and frankly quite interesting!!
pros: Excellent location in the heart of Tavira! cons:

pros: A beautiful historic building sympathetically modernised and in a fabulous location. cons: Our room on the second floor was a little cramped and the only hot water for drinks in the room was through a Nespresso machine which was not hot enough to brew tea!
pros: Outstanding historic building. Great service cons: Coffee making options in room and at breakfast could be better

pros: loved this place great mix of old and new 
excellent staff lovely big room with separate bathroom & toilet lots of character. Super breakfast. cons: Pillows were hard but the staff changed them immediately
pros: Very Nice Hotel with very professional staff cons:
pros: Beautiful building and grounds. cons:

pros: Great location beautiful facility parking on-site very nice breakfast were all stand outs. cons: A small fruit basket was thoughtfully provided to us shortly after our arrival. Unfortunately when I looked at it the next day it was loaded with ants.
pros: Great location in historic building. Spacious bedroom. Awesome breakfast. Super friendly staff. Parking onsite very convenient. cons: There is nothing to be disliked.
pros: It was a revelation.  I had no expectations but could not have imagined the grace beauty and class of the hotel cons:

pros: The staff support was very good! Breakfasts excellent! Dinner not such good value and quality as some of the restaurants in Tavira! Further as with many classic hotels in particular  the ‘lighting’ in the bedroom was frankly poor! Budget hotels mostly have thought this through not least perhaps because the rooms are generally smaller! In all we enjoyed the Pousada in Tavira. The building has been wonderfully adapted for its role as an Hotel of note! cons: See above reading lights in the bedroom.
pros: Great location and ambiance cons:

pros: Location was key for our visit it was perfect. Our suite met our needs and the overall facilities were exactly as required cons: Lighting in our suite was poor for a lady. The suite was nice but as it was on two floors we lost the feeling of it being spacious but It was functional. If we had wished to entertain in our room it would have been perfect. The bed seemed like a double rather than king size which we normally expect. We prefer super king but we still slept perfectly!
pros: The staff could not have been more friendly or more helpful! ￼ A wonderful location in a beautiful little town! cons:

pros: Location location!!! Staff was a pleasure  it was so close to everything ! cons: Nothing we did not like . However felt sorry for wait staff / Bar they seemed understaffed and overwhelmed at times . But gave 100 percent of their effort !

pros: Good breakfast at all times. cons: One evening had dinner at the Pousada. Not very good.
Seems to be groups of ladies (English ) using the Pousada for short breaks and they can be a little "noisy"

pros: Fantastic location. Beautiful building well kept. Staff were fabulous. Really friendly and helpful. cons: The room was ok but missing a few touches. Tea/coffee making facilities would have been helpful and I wish hotels of this standard would replace drinking water daily.

pros: Breakfast was absolutely amazing - fresh nutritious and tasty - wide choice.
Staff were amazing - nothing was too much trouble and they were very friendly. cons: Nothing to not like!
pros: Everything went well.  Breakfast was great cons:
pros: It was a lovely facility located within walking distance of the downtown area. cons:

pros: Excellent breakfast choices. 
Great central location.
Very helpful and efficient staff cons: Poolside staff to circulate to ask guests if they want drinks or food

pros: The whole atmosphere is welcoming and friendly  the breakfast was superb cleanliness spot on. Peaceful and with beautiful views cons: Missed having kettle in room as like a hot drink upon waking especially as breakfast not till 8 and we are early risers
pros: Location spacious property helpful staff breakfast & dinner great cons: Room a bit dark bathrobes would have been nice
pros: Position & facilities  friendliness of staff cons: It was all good

pros: Quiet and peaceful good position in the town cons: No coffee making facilities in the room  i bit strange we thought for an expensive hotel ? However when we queried it they put a coffee machine in our room so all good in the end !
pros: Beautiful building in good location in the pretty town of Tavira.  Nice pool and outdoor areas.  Excellent breakfast.  Well equipped room with terrace. Secure parking useful. cons:

pros: Breakfast is a feast for the eyes and taste: rich selection outstanding for quality truly excellent.
The staff is young but very professional and very motivated always smiling and helpful.
The whole hotel area is fascinating rich in history and very quiet and relaxing. cons: We’d have appreciated a wider bed; we should have booked twin beds.

pros: Breakfast was very good.  Dinner was also very good
Location was perfect.  Service was excellent.  No complaints. cons: Nothing.

pros: We stayed in a suite and it was very spacious. The bed was very comfortable and we were provided different pillow choices. We ate dinner at the restaurant and it was very good with plenty of options to choose from. The breakfast was also very good with lots of selections to meet anyones breakfast needs. They have a great pool area and the bar is in close proximity.

The property is well located an easy 5 - 10 minute walk to Tavira centre and close to restaurants and site seeing.
 
The staff was very helpful and friendly. cons: I wish we could have stayed longer.
pros: The building was amazing and the rooms and leisure areas were beautifully decorated. Breakfast was delicious with a great variety of continental and cooked options. cons: Nothing not to like!

pros: The hotel has a private parking lot which was a determining factor when booking the reservation but once we saw and experienced the property we found that it's truly exceptional and far exceeded our expectations. cons:
pros: Excellent breakfast lovely pool good location very helpful staff private parking cons: Hard mattresses music in breakfast area.

pros: The staff was extremely helpful and the property is stunning. If you get the chance take the tour of the convent that they offer. You won’t be disappointed staying here. cons: The coffee machine. The coffee is surprisingly sub par.

pros: Beautiful calm location
Cool courtyard
Quiet pool
Fantastic breakfast
Lovely location cons: Nothing

pros: The staff is incredibly nice. The rooms and the whole building are exceptional. The food although not cheap was excellent. The location is right in the center of Tavira which is a city that remains faithful to its origins. cons: Shower water pressure was not perfect but that was really a minor detail.

pros: The best place we stayed in the Algarve it exceeded our expectations by far. One of the calmest and most easy going hotel experiences we have ever had. Even though fully booked there was so much space and calmness to find in the building. Fantastic location to walk to all main attractions of Tavira. The pool area was an oasis in the middle of the town. Fantastic breakfast with fresh regional products and specialties. Very good and friendly service from the staff and the most amazing setting to eat inside the courtyard of the old monastery. cons: There is nothing to complain about our stay the smallest inconvenience was taken care of by the friendly and caring staff. 
If you're not a morning person it is best to take breakfast indoors the courtyard chairs can make an awful noise. But the experience of dining there makes up for it!

pros: Hotel is in a great location close to Tavira town easy to get ferry across to the beautiful island walking distance to bus station. Staff are super friendly welcoming and helpful hotel itself is beautiful with a lovely pool and grounds. Breakfast was plentiful great choices attention by Chef at all times. cons: The air conditioning wasnt very effective it was particularly hot the week we stayed (high 30's) so maybe this didnt help. Other guests asked to be moved as had same issue. We found the tea facility in our room slightly odd there were 3 teabags no coffee no milk and you had to pay 3 euros per teabag if you wanted any more. You could request a Nespresso machine but were charged 3 euros per pod! For a 4 star hotel found this to be disappointing. These were our only issues everything else was wonderful.
pros: Beautiful very zen and amazing food and great pool cons:

pros: Pousada Convento is in a fantastic location very close to the castle with a short walk up/downhill to the city centre.
We loved the serenity of the courtyard on arrival where we sat and enjoyed a drink. The variety of breakfast options the quietness of the pool area and of course the courtesy and attentiveness of staff. The large open spaces and decor around the hotel gave it such a regal feeling. 
We spent 9 nights here for my 60th birthday and we couldn't have picked a better stay for this occasion. It was made so much more special when I was greeted with cake and champagne left in our room. 
I booked a facial and massage which was worth every penny. 
We also ate a superb meal at the hotel restaurant one evening.
We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Thank you for making our stay so special. cons: There wasn't much not to like. Perhaps at least another cabana at the pool.
pros: Fantastic location 5 minutes walk to the center of Tavira and all the restaurants . cons: No complaints

pros: Location and unique historic setting. Beautiful restored old convent. Good restaurants on site. Free parking on the site. cons: Inexperienced staff in need of more supervision to meet the standards that this location asks for however all very friendly and did their best.  

Peace & quietness depends on profile of guests staying there.  If several families with small kids are there  the place feels like kindergarten very soon.

pros: Absolutely beautiful place a hotel for quiet and peacefulness excellent buffet breakfast and the staff cannot do enough for you.
Highly recommended and 5 min walk onto the avenida with beautiful restaurants and bars. A stunning Pousada. Entertainment each night in the square. High recommended. cons:

pros: Beautiful historic building with all the comforts. The best breakfast with many options comfortable beds modern bathrooms beautiful pool area kind staff. cons: The only suggestion would be to put a coffee machine in the rooms but no big deal.
pros: Ambience cons: Slow service

pros: Brilliant location and very friendly staff. The breakfast was very good and the room clean and tidy. cons: The bed was quite hard and the curtain in our room didn’t close completely so it got very bright in the morning.
pros: Fantastic building and location. Excellent staff and quality of food. cons: The air conditioning in the room really struggled to cool the room down.
pros: Excellent breakfast choice. Comfortable beds spacious rooms wonderful surroundings and great location. cons:
pros: Reception staff were excellent and went out of their way to secure us a dinner reservation in town at late notice. Marvellous tranquil pool and beautiful historic building cons:
pros: Great cons:

pros: Unique historic building superbly converted as a high quality hotel. Excellent range of services and facilities. Ideal location for visiting the town of Tavira whilst offering a quiet and tranquil location.
The hotel was spotless and it was great to see that the local people took great pride in their lovely town. cons: It would help if the website described availability of tea/coffee facilities in all bedrooms as these appear to be only in superior rooms and suites.
The website could also mention that beach towels are provided for guests using the pool.

pros: The breakfast excellent opening hour very accommodating at our age82 we don’t need raucous music all the time nor loud aggressive behaviour.   There was an essence of calm and tranquillitypossibly due to the cloister architecture and the building’s history.   It was in an ideal spot for everything else in Tavira.   The staff were more than helpful with a smile. cons: The power in the shower in the bedroom could have been stronger
pros: Great cons:
pros: A great pool area and a beautiful old convent. cons: The room became a little warm in the middle of the night.
pros: Good breakfast big room nice swimmingpool and very good staff cons: The beds were too stiff
pros: Breakfast offered multiple variety of excellent food cons:

pros: Location excellent for exploring Tavira. 
Professionalism and responsiveness of staff to any queries was impressive. 
Excellent breakfast. 
Quality of service. 
Tranquil atmosphere throughout the Pousada made for a very relaxing stay cons: Nothing. All excellent.
pros: its architectural charm. cons: rooms are smallish and under equipped for a hotel at this price. E.g. no separate shower just one over the bath.

pros: beautiful building. Lot of history around the place.
room was nice
swimming pool was brilliant
staff were the highlight. so nice and helpful cons: not enough plug points in the room
pros: Amazing historic facilities.  Professional expert and friendly staff.  Truly exceptional stay. cons:
pros: Excellent staff who were always helpful and professional. They are your best asset. cons: Food perhaps could have had a little more variety and choice but not a disaster.
pros: food was great. we had lunch there. the location was good. The staff were professional. we enjoyed our stay there cons: No complaints
pros: a beautiful historic building housing a first rate modern hotel. excellent staff and extraordinary service. perfect location. cons:
pros: excellent breakfast. Nice poolside. cons: nothing
pros: We loved the location the staff  and the property. The breakfast was really good many options. cons: the beds are unusually hard and the pillows uncomfortable.
pros: Outstanding breakfast! Many many options . Fruit was fresh and flavorful. And when was the last time you tasted delicious scrambled eggs at a breakfast buffet? Here! cons:

pros: this hotel is a historical beautifully restored building the cloister where we are dinner is atmospheric and exceptional 
free parking is an absolute bonus cons: there was  nothing we didn’t like  the food atmosphere and location were all excellent  and the pool is beautiful 
we were slightly disappointed because we did request a room in the old part of the hotel but we were given one in the new area

pros: I liked the tranquility closeness of hotel to different restaurants places of historic interest all within walking distance and in at least one restaurant the cuisine was of a standard matching any of the top restaurants in London cons: In terms of hygiene and with Covid still in evidence the beds should have quilts (low tog) and blankets dispensed with- the matress was firm but pillows were brick hard and very uncomfortable- a complimentary bottle of water should be provided daily and more teabags
pros: wonderful public area cons: room size
pros: Great location within five mins walking distance of the main square. Staff were really helpful and kind going the extra mile to celebrate a birthday whilst out there. cons:
pros: Lovely hotel cons: The air-con doesn't seem to working well our bedroom was very warm.
pros: This is a stunning hotel in a great location. All staff were excellent and breakfast was absolutely delicious!! cons:
pros: Everything cons: Not  a thing
pros: nice and peaceful.  breakfast was very nice.  staff were amazing. cons: two single beds pushed together for one person.

pros: Good rooms but not exceptional. Lovely cloister/patio for breakfast and evening meals.Food in restaurant was of a good standard. Good secure parking. cons: Limited seating in shade around pool area. Rooms are expensive.

pros: We appreciated an early checkin and room upgrade also the treats chocolates and fruits. The views from the windows were lovely. The bathroom was great. The staff were really helpful and communicative. Because we left before breakfast we were provided with a picnic box and juice/water which was much appreciated. cons: We decided to have dinner in the Pousada and loved the ambience and being able to sit in the cloister area. Unfortunately we had to wait a very long time for our meal which was a pity. The waitress was clearly embarassed and apologised several times.  It was not her fault and she did her absolute best. The food was great but by the time it came we were getting tired. Were there not enough staff in the kitchen?  The bill was wrong when it arrived.
pros: Selection and cooked options cons: Coffee

pros: Friendly helpful staff. Brilliant location. Breakfast buffet really great lots of choice and good quality produce. Beautiful old building tastefully converted into a hotel. cons: There was nothing to dislike. Only thing that could have improved stay would be a kettle in the room with tea and coffee.
pros: everything cons: nothing
pros: beauty parking location cons:
pros: Calm ambience. Excellent service and friendly and service-minded staff. Superb location in Tavira. Safe parking. Dog friendly (they got a very nice present). cons:

pros: The building is amazing and in a great spot to explore Tavira. Car parking available secure and free. The room was a good size and quiet during the night. Pool area nice but we didn’t use it. The food was very good and we ate dinner here as arrived late. cons: No Coffee making facilities in the room and I wake early so had to wait for a drink. The restaurant was a little quiet and the atmosphere a bit subdued. Maybe better background music would help.

pros: Love that it’s an historic building and site renovated beautifully with luxury amenities. cons: Driving to the parking location was difficult initially. 
No one was manning the cocktail bar in the evening which was inconvenient.

pros: It’s an amazing property steeped in history so peaceful and luxurious in a superb location. The facilities meet every expectation and the fabulous staff make sure that all of your needs are met. I want to go back now! cons: nothing!
pros: peaceful and cool cons: short of parking spaces

pros: my family loved staying at this quiet clean boutique hotel. the rooms were very comfortable and clean. the staff was very friendly. the breakfast buffet was excellent. cons: pool was not heated. weather was nice and sunny temperatures in the mid 70s but water in the pool was a little too cold for us to swim. we really enjoyed everything else at this hotel but it would have been nice to go for a swim.
pros: We had a lovely stay. Staff were lovely cons: All was good
pros: Staff very helpful good breakfast big room good location cons: Found the mattress uncomfortable and pillows flat. Also duvet way too hot
pros: it’s location was perfect. Central location and it’s old traditional style. cons: could do with a little updating around the pool area.

pros: location and level of accommodation and breakfast cons: Limited information from staff/reception on facilities on site what to do in town etc.  The printed brochure was almost unreadable….small print in grey and difficult to see or read.  No general information on Tavira and what it has to offer posted or in the rooms….most decent hotels have a binder of information in the rooms.
pros: in the historical district. calm neighborhood   The best location for this lovely town cons: Pricy
pros: historic neighborhood great staff beautiful room lovely common areas subterranean ruins yummy breakfast nice pool AND feral cats! cons: pool not heated( March)

pros: beautiful property in the historic part of Tavira but with easy access to the main areas. the staff were lovely and the breakfast exceptional. good sized twin room with spacious shower room cons: no coffee making facilities in the room
pros: location room with a balcony open courtyard pool breakfast bathroom products parking old and updated architecture and interiors staff cons: liked everything

pros: Tavira is a very charming town. The location of the hotel is excellent and a quick walk to the center. The breakfast was fairly good. This hotel is not as rich in decor as others in the group cons:
pros: Staff were very professional and very friendly. Provided cake wine fruit and port as birthday gift cons: Charging for teabags

pros: Breakfast was excellent. Staff v friendly. Room was a little cold on occasions but generally fine. Dustbin lorries were right outside our room Sunday night and v noisy. Having parking was great. cons: Would have liked tea topped up each day and some fresh milk.
pros: Staff were very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast and dinner both very good. Excellent location cons: Bar was soulless

pros: The whole building is beautiful and the central courtyard stunning. We stayed in room 1 which had a Juliet balcony overlooking the park and chuch at the front of the building. Pool area is lovely and relaxing.
Location is excellent for a short walk into the town centre whilst remaining quiet.
Staff went out of their way to cater for us and really made the whole stay wonderfully enjoyable. Breakfast was excellent offering fresh juices a huge selection of cold meats and cheeses with the  choice of freshly prepared omelettes etc. cons: Nothing.
pros: It was a very special place...... a haven of tranquility.  Wonderful historic building and beautifully restored. cons:

pros: good location with a parking courtyard
comfortable room
great staff cons:

pros: The building is historic and beautifully restored. The room was well decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast was lavish and included local specialities.. Members of staff went out of their way to be helpful. cons: I did not think that the level of the cooking at dinner came close to measuring up to the other attributes of the hotel.
pros: Lovely and quiet staff very friendly cons: coffee could be better!!!

pros: Very nice and cozy hotel with a lot of history in a beautiful town. The location is great (right in the middle of the old town) and close to the key touristic points. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very helpful and supportive at all times! The SPA services are also quite enjoyable :) Thanks a lot for a nice stay! cons: Everything was good nothing to complain about :)

pros: The building is amazing with lots of character. We were able to see other rooms at an equivalent price and changed to a nicer room. The hotel is ideally placed for exploring Tavira. The breakfast was great with some interesting offerings. cons:
pros: Beautiful building. Lovely dinner. Friendly and helpful staff. cons:
pros: such a calming atmosphere. the courtyard and pool are beautiful cons: the new rooms aren’t as good as the older ones
pros: location breakfast parking on site cons: paying for room water
pros: good central location friendly staff nice breakfast historic atmosphere cons: nothing
pros: The food cons: Got stuck in the lift but lived to tell the tale.
pros: Location building comfortable rooms with friendly and thoughtful service throughout cons:
pros: It’s location and how well it has been modernised cons: The bed was too hard

pros: Rita at the reception was very friendly and helpful coming to our room to adjust the TV for us sending someone to fix the windows and adjust the heat and later arranged a tuk tuk tour of the old town for us. cons: N/A
pros: Beautiful historic building great location and friendly helpful staff. cons: The bar was a bit too quiet!

pros: Very friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful building. Spacious rooms. Excellent food in the restaurant at reasonable prices. Good breakfast. cons: Tea and coffee making facilities in the room would have been nice.
pros:  cons: Drinks at bar were very expensive

pros: Lovely room with a view of the courtyard. Comfortable beds. Reception very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast excellent with lots of choices.
Private secure car parking.
Very close to all things Tavira has to offer. Highly recommended. cons:
pros: The old building from days as a Convent was very tastefully converted the whole decor inside and out was excellent cons:
pros: Great location with parking. very helpful staff & the on-site restaurant was good cons: no real coffee at breakfast

pros: Very nice Pousada and also very centrally situated. The room was very nice and had a good size. Breakfast was excellent. They even had Nespresso coffee at breakfast. There was a lot to choose from: at least 6 tipes of cheese bread an pastelleria. I you needed special things for breakfast you can ask and you will probably get it: for instance mayonaise and mustard OR freshly baked waffle. The staff was very kind and helpful! cons: The shower could have been 'stronger' but otherwise everything was perfect.
pros: wonderful attentive staff and a great location cons: food was great except the coffee at breakfast- a different additional nespresso type machine did appear on the last day to help rectify this

pros: We really loved the property the location and the fantastic staff. Breakfast was amazing. Overall we would highly recommend and visit again. cons: The only little niggles were: the coffee with breakfast - sorry but it was undrinkable; and the hard mattress with hard springs that bruised my hips and kept waking me up! I also think having some more information about the area walks sights etc. would be good (the tourist info in town was shut the first few days we were there). Obviously you can find stuff online but sometimes it helps to have real life copies! But really minor niggles as I say this was lovely and we’d definitely return.

pros: Beautiful historical property that has retained many of its original features and yet is a comfortable and efficient hotel. Staff were friendly polite and helpful. cons: Dinner plates should be hotter.
pros: everything! ambiance! location! staff! cons:

pros: Any visitor to this (former convent and garrison) heritage hotel may be assured of excellent hospitality in a beautiful and quiet premises. It has an elevated location very near the old castle and only five minutes walk from the town centre. Superlatives fail me here - you'll love it. cons: The hotel bar is adequate but could offer a wider variety.
pros: Beautiful location; impecable property; attention to detail; very comfortable bed; super nice helpful staff; Rita at the front desk was an angel. cons: Nothing
pros: the building location swimming pool breakfast cons: n/a

pros: The building and location
Breakfast. cons: More could have been made of the internal courtyard vis a vie dining and ad hoc drinks/bar.

pros: I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights following a holiday in Cabanas when my husband had to have an emergency operation at the hospital in Faro it was a very distressing time and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful and supportive.  Nothing was too much trouble and it was an absolute oasis of calm to come back too for my husband when he was discharged. cons: Nothing
pros: Excellent location and hotel parking behind locked gate.  Beautiful restored building and lovely pool (unheated in October!) cons:
pros: Room was very comfortable. Sheets were spotless and high quality cons: Breakfast could have been better but some nice choices particularly if you like sweet things.
pros: atmosphere location cons: minor point but we stayed in room 11 and at night could hear the constant thud of the kitchen doors below as staff passed in and out
pros: Ambience location friendly and helpful staff cons: Slightly disappointed in the quality of the restaurant meal
pros: Very good breakfast room and location excellent cons: Nothing negative to say

pros: fabulous location near the castle and two churches. integrity of the convent respected with modern touches as needed. comfortable pool area excellent breakfast. very comfortable beds and linens cons: as in many hotels in Portugal toilet seat did not stand up

pros: interesting building and history. this came recommended to us and we are not disappointed.
all the staff are very helpful and arranged restaurant booking taxi and other requirements we had. cons: beds are a little hard ok for me but some might find them difficult.

pros: The building is breath taking and it's very good location cons: The breakfast was only a standard buffet. I would expect better and have experienced in the past for this standard of hotel. We could order eggs with the breakfast but they only got it correct twice out of four. The bar in the evening took over 15 minutes to bring us drinks.

The housekeeping for the room was strange. We received chocolates every day but only water and fruit on the first day. There was only one tea bag which was not replaced and never any coffee provided.

pros: The staff were excellent in every respect
Restaurant service improved since previous visit in 2019 cons: Nothing at All
Level of service consistently good
No reason for compliant on any issue
pros: location cons:

pros: Truly relaxing stay in this architectural gem in Tavira. Centuries old stone arches courtyard staircases some wonderful art & a pool in a garden framed by a picturesque ruin. Superb breakfast (the cheeses!!). Delightful efficient accommodating staff throughout. cons: The coffee at breakfast is pretty 
awful. Though don't let that put you off - all else is perfection but it would be nice to see it improve on our next visit.
pros: The property was beautiful a wonderful location so quiet pool lovely breakfast amazing and staff so friendly! cons:

pros: the size of rooms the feeling of spaciousness cons: youngsters playing ball games around the 
pool being noisy which is doesn’t seem fitting f
fitting in the otherwise tranquil
surroundings
pros: beautiful and well cared for cons: could have  a gym
pros: very helpful staff. Very clean facilities. Lovely ambience and beautiful grounds and pool area cons:
pros: Magnificent renovation of the Covent into a modern luxury hotel while retaining the authenticity of the original building. cons: Better service around the pool area and adjoining bar.
pros: historical site and close to everything cons: coffee machine at breakfast

pros: location inside town wall and authentic old building  charming interior.  we booked last room available in a new part of the Pousada the room was comfortable however less attractive than rooms in an older part. Strong advice to ask for the room in the old part. cons: not much however breakfast could be better organized without need to reserve time in advance. coffee machine with instant coffee is not up to the modern standards.

pros: The location was excellent near Tavira castle. The hotel itself was a lovely building with old world charm and a nice relaxing pool area. It really was a haven. The staff were for the most part helpful helping with things like tuk tuk booking. The room was elegant and comfortable. cons: The hotel could have been a bit better with helping with restaurant bookings. I was just told to try my luck as apparently it is hard to get a booking this time of year though I would have thought a hotel of this reputation would have had links to good restaurants where it would have priority to book. The breakfast was decent though there could have been more savoury vegetarian options. There was also an odd incident where they decided to change my mattress during the middle of my stay for no clear reason.
pros: pool cons: no balcony in most rooms need to book slot for breakfast in advance
pros: everything cons: nothing

pros: My family and I were on a whirlwind tour of Spain Portugal and Morocco and Pousada Convento de Tavira was a place that everyone wanted to go back to.  We wish we had spent longer and the staff is above and beyond kind.  And the breakfast and pool were outstanding. cons:

pros: The courtyard of the building with cloisters surrounding it makes a lovely place to sit and have breakfast or drinks and a chat - nice and cool in the shade and warm in the sun but bright and restful wherever you sit.  The breakfast was exceptionally good with a different choice each day of pastries and other goodies.  The staff were all welcoming and attentive without ever becoming intrusive - it always felt like we were being left to enjoy ourselves in our own temporary home.  The room was fine although the bed was firmer than we are used to and it had a balcony overlooking the pool.  The pool is set in a lovely relaxing environment in the sun with a few trees to provide shade and is surrounded by sun-loungers and over-head parasols and access to tables and chairs at which to enjoy snacks and drinks from the adjacent bar area.  It was cleaned each morning and set at a perfect temperature for a refreshing swim in the sunshine. 

All of the staff through out the hotel were a delight - helpful cheerful and courteous.

The central location gave us access to local restaurants and tennis courts in Tavira but also the local villages of Santa Luzia Cacela Velha and Moncarapacho for our favourite beaches and restaurants. cons: Once or twice the scrambled egg was a little over-cooked a bit firm and dry.  The toaster can be a bit of a bottle-neck and could perhaps be upgraded to provide multiple slots to allow more than one simultaneous user.

The beds felt a little tired and firmer than we are used to - perhaps thought needs to be given to upgrading these.

Perhaps there could be more parasols round the pool to provide all sun-loungers with access to shade.

Once or twice the car park was overfull - it is difficult for most people to see that many of the spaces covered by the wisteria are actually available for two cars not just one.

A small point this: I appreciate that it is courteous and respectful for the reception to stand up and greet new arrivals but from time to time it felt quite regimented that all of the reception staff would stand (to attention) in unison on our entry to the hotel. I am sure it is good practice but I felt a bit sorry for them.
pros: Beautiful building: spacious rooms great facilities pool towels etc and excellent breakfasts and restaurant cons:

pros: Good clean hotel.with very helpful staff. Breakfast was good and location great. We particularly liked the availability of secure parking space and swimming pool facilities. cons: Dinner was good but not fantastic.
pros: I liked that it was historical cons: I think the bedroom was small for a family of 3

pros: Beautiful old property free upgrade on arrival to tower bedroom with wonderful view. Pool area was really nice & very quiet & private. Lots of nice restaurants & shops in Tavira just 2 minute walk from the Tavira Convent Hotel cons:
pros: calmness and excellent customer service cons:
pros: beautifully kept cons:

pros: Beautiful building - very sympathetically converted. Excellent location cons: The service was not particularly good as the hotel was obviously short of staff. The breakfast was pretty average and we felt that both the food and service wasn’t worth the price we paid.
pros: Breakfast was good enjoyed the pool and location. Room was very nice. A bit more expensive but overall great stay cons: More food options for breakfast
pros:  cons: very dark in rooms

pros: Fabulous location in a wonderful old convent. Breakfast was great lots of choice. Pool was very nice staff were really helpful parking was super useful. cons: Only criticism would be decor in the common parts is a little dated.
pros: We stayed here for a wedding reception and everything went perfectly cons: Nothing

pros: This is a fully renovated pousada with all modern facilities and very nice rooms.  We had booked a room with a terrace - it was very comfortable.  The staff were very helpful and nice.  They helped us also book our sightseeing. cons: They need to develop more options for vegetarians.  We reached Tavira a bit late in the evening after a long drive and didn’t want to go out for dinner.  But there were very few options for vegetarian food at the restaurant.  This is a premium property and so they should make sure they have a reasonable selection for everyone staying.

pros: The rooms were very hot . Apparently the AC is a central button. So when you try to put it on the temperature you desire  it doesn’t work.
We had some trouble sleeping due to the heat 😔 cons:
pros: so beautiful and so beautifully renovated. clean lines…although the pool was cold it was swimable. cons: the pool the floor in the rooms the location.
pros: courtyard and pool area cons: beds weren’t comfortable enough

pros: Breakfast
Friendly staff
Room
Location cons:
pros: Beautiful location surrounded by churches and portions of the original wall. cons:
pros: excellent breakfast good location for tavira and for A22 cons: nothing
pros: Beautiful old building and great location.  Excellent breakfast cons:

pros: Lovely building and surroundings but it was cold and unfortunately there was no heating however the staff did manage to move us to a room with some sun which was much warmer. cons: Breakfast service a bit hit and miss and the restaurant areas were cold in the morning.

pros: The staff were very helpful & friendly. 
The hotels location was good because it is in the historic part of Tavira.
The food served at the buffet breakfast was varied & good. cons: Our room was comfortable but quite small. Unfortunately our room was on the north east side of the hotel it only got the very early morning sun (in early March) so it was too cold to sit out on the balcony.
At times the hotel seemed to be understaffed.
pros: A charming calm tranquil pousada with very professional personable and helpful staff. cons:

pros: Exceptional reception team
Beautiful property
Super room
Fantastic location
Great breakfast
Nice bar with reasonable prices 
Good onsite parking cons: N/A
pros:  cons: sometimes there was a shortage of staff for the bar area

pros: Beautiful Hotel in great location.   Very clean.  Breakfast exceptionally sumptuous.  Staff very friendly and courteous especially Alex on reception.  We had a late arrival on first night and bar manager arrange a quick tostada that was very much appreciated. cons:

pros: Room was quite large and well appointed. Bathroom was very nice. Check in was great. Staff were very polite helpful and obviously well trained! Place is lovely. I would totally recommend. cons: The bed was a little too soft and uncomfortable for me.  Hotel’s coffee could have been better. But that is a small thing. The rest of the breakfast was quite good.
pros: location and beauty cons: restaurant and food - poor quality and expensive
pros: The highlight was Daniella who went absolutely above and beyond to ensure we had a great trip. Thank you!! cons:

pros: Beautiful building with very nice facilities. The room was very charming and comfortable. The staff always very friendly and breakfast was great with super friendly staff once again. There is parking reserved for the guests and a beautiful outdoor area with a swimming pool. cons: It's not the most affordable place but you pay for the uniqueness of staying at a historical building.
pros: the architecture and position cons: the decor is somewhat outdated also coffee and tea facilities in the room would be great

pros: Excellent Wi-Fi very friendly staff spacious room even though it was the cheapest on offer. Nice and warm in January. Good breakfast. cons: No coffee/ tea making facilities a bottle of plain water was provided the first day but this was not renewed during our stay. Although this hotel came up in the ‘spa’ filter on Booking.com there was only a massage room. We had to ask the receptionist to open the car park door every time we had to enter or exit I would have expected a token operated arrangement.
pros: Everything exceeded our expectations. cons: nothing

pros: This is an excellent hotel in a very picturesque area of Tavira. Beautiful building with a great design in all the communal areas and rooms. The staff were very helpful and kind and Eudmeme our host at breakfast was so sweet so accommodating and so friendly! We just loved it there! cons:
pros: Without exception the entire staff were welcoming friendly and did everything they could to make our stay memorable. Faultless. cons: I liked every single thing about this exceptional hotel.

pros: This was the grandest and most stylish of hotels in which we've stayed in Portugal. 

The staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much effort. We had booked this hotel for my wife's birthday and in the late afternoon room service knocked on our bedroom door. I opened it to see a waitress carrying a tray laden with chocolate cake and champagne. I said: "You must have the wrong room; I have not ordered anything." She said "It's your wife's birthday; this is on the house." What a surprise! And how very thoughtful. (The birthday must have been identified when our passport details were taken during check-in.)

Breakfast was very good; wi-fi was sufficient for video streaming; parking was easy as the hotel has its own private facilities. 

Highly recommended. cons:

pros: The location and breakfast were good cons: The room was very tired with chipped brown furniture. There was a large hole in the bedspread. The light fitting on the balcony floor was broken and the jagged metal sticking out was dangerous and a trip hazard. Only 4 tea bags and one bottle of water provided for the whole stay no replenishments allowed. 
We were asked after our first night to fill in a survey about our stay. We were honest and wrote as above stating we would be available the next morning to discuss if needed. On returning from dinner at 11pm that evening the reception staff challenged us about our comments. He was extremely defensive and annoyed about what we had said and made us feel very uncomfortable. This really spoilt our evening.

pros: Breakfast was great. The room was great clean comfortable bed and very nice. The bathroom was nice and clean but the water pressure was not good. The wifi was problematic it worked in certain areas and not in others even though the signal was good throughout the property this was 'fixed' in the next business day after a complaint was made to reception. cons: The restaurant! Usually the Pousadas chain hotels have great dining experiences but this one was not the case The wine list was poor without ANY dry white wines the waiter was also not very knowledgable about the few wines they did cary. The staff at the checkin although nice were highly inefficient as we waited for quite a while for then to find out printed files. Lastly the water pressure for the showers was quite poor.

pros: Absolutely fantastic town with wonderful & friendly local people a great variety & quality of restaurants and beautiful endless beaches which you reach with the pleasant ferry ride. The hotel itself and its courtyard are beautiful and the breakfasts wonderful. The young staff were all really friendly especially the waiter & bartender Andreia who with her genuinely lovely smile made you feel at home & looked after. cons: Extremely expensive hotel for what you get. There should be nicer sun beds and more than just one lounge bed! Wooden terrace around the  pool needs renovating as it had several loose boards and rubbish stuck underneath. The bar had a very limited selection with no dry espumante nor any nice dry wine by the glas and just one of each spirits. The 3 hotel rooms (we had to move rooms twice due to a leak and then a broken toilet which broke was fixed then broke again in the evening) were quite sad feeling with shower inside a cheap PVC bath and scratched wood flooring. One only gets one free water bottle. For a hotel of this category you would expect free still water as the tap water tastes strongly of chlorine.

pros: Great location lovely building cons: This is a property that has clearly once had a lot of investment but a long time ago. It is badly in need of a makeover. If you charge 5 star prices you need to ensure the facilities match that. They don’t. It is therefore way overvalued at the moment .
pros: Good staff wonderful building. cons: Understaffed. Food was poor except for their evening restaurant which was average. Very hard to get a drink the bar was always unstaffed

pros: We have stayed before disappointed with our room No 1 as room 20 same price more superior. Pillows awful so hard and uncomfortable unable to sleep. cons: See above 
No hot water until 10.45 in the morning had to shower in cold water
pros: Location staff were friendly cons: Better selection of courses for evening meals also expensive.  Breakfast was nice but food cold please heat plates

pros: Attractive well located historical building. 
Breakfasts were fantastic with a wide range of offerings. One of the restaurant staff a lady called Andrae was exceptionally helpful and caring a great asset to the hotel. On site parking was very helpful. cons: It was chilly and the hotel was very cold. It took some time with the room AC heating to warm it up. Every time you wanted to enter or exit the car park you had to ask reception to open the gate  they should invest in some kind if automated system.
pros: Amazing old building which was very nicely furnished cons: Slow check in process

pros: The pool and the breakfast are very good. cons: Clogged bath tub
Very old and outdated rooms
Noisy A/C impossible to sleep with it on
Cleaning staff entered in the room before checkout time and cleaned with us still there

pros: The historic building is a beautiful setting and the courtyard and pool area are relaxing picturesque spots. cons: The rooms are rather outdated dull and dreary. In need of a bit of a refresh to feel more welcoming.
pros:  cons: Coffee horrible!
pros: beautiful property. great boutique hotel cons: all good
pros: Staff went out of their way when we asked to change room due to its size. Moved us to a large suite that was available at no cost. cons: Breakfast was okay but not the best we've had.

pros: Staff were very helpful (especially Alex who was very welcoming & kind). The building was beautiful and we were interested in the history. The breakfast buffet was excellent. cons: The bed was very hard and the towels were snagged and tatty. There was shampoo and shower gel dispensers in the shower but no conditioner. Not very serious but in a 4 star hotel it should be better.

pros: Location very central comfortable beds and pillows cons: Stained lampshades dust around edges of floors in bedroombroken outside terrace light.Tired furniture in room.
Breakfast was disorganized.
Having to get out of your car and go to reception to ask them to open garage door. It needs a code fitting or a buzzer to reception
pros: Shower very poor ! Room dark  no coffe or tea woke 5am with children crying cons: Pool fanatic building great receptionist very helpful
pros:  cons: Bat service poor early in the evening.

pros: the bones are beautiful but they have not decorated or added luxury to elevate it beyond an old hotel.  breakfast was nice.  staff very helpful.  good location. cons: courtyard bare bones. beds and pillows super hard and uncomfortable. rooms looked a little haggard and bathrooms need updating.

pros: Great location. 
Lovely staff. cons: The breakfast was poor. especially considering the room rates. 
The rooms are quite austere. Not terribly comfortable.

pros: Variety and quality of the breakfast was excellent. The breakfast room was very pleasant. cons: The Pousada was expensive and lacked extra touches to make it an indulgence. (I'm thinking robes welcome drinks nice bedside chocolates treats at the front desk).

pros: nice location with a great convent ambiance and cloister
very nice free parking in town and good vreakfast cons: no heating system as they divided to close it on March 1

pros: Atmosphere 
Location
History cons: Chaotic breakfast
No kettle in room
pros: Beautiful relaxed and welcoming. cons: The lighting in the guest rooms could be better.
pros: Es un lugar excepcional y muy agradable. El personal nos trató muy bien y el desayuno ha sido el mejor que hemos tenido en mucho tiempo. cons:
pros: Nos encantó la experiencia el lugar es increíble y el servicio excelente además el lugar tiene mucho encanto y el desayuno es fantástico. cons:

pros: Hotel muy confortable y tranquilo situado en el centro de Tavira.
Excelente servicio cons:
pros: Tido. cons: O wc podia estar renovado. E vista para telhado.
pros: La zona de la piscina espectacular . Jardín muy tranquilo cons: Las habitaciones y el cuarto de baño un poco antiguo
pros: Edificio histórico y entorno cons: Todo bien
pros: A simpatia e disponibilidade de todo staff cons:
pros: La piscina muy bien cons: El suelo de madera de la habitación crujía mucho al pisarlo

pros: Convemto muito bem recuperado para hotel; quarto excelente; óptimos pequenos almoços; restaurante de boa qualidade; pessoal simpático competente e sempre com um sorriso- até os estagiários demonstrando vontade de evoluir
  Só não dou 10 porque o 10 dei a hotéis como o Hotel de l"Europe em Amsterdam o Hotel Ritz de Londres ou outros desse nível cons: Francamente como excedeu as minhas espectativas diria praticamente.nada - quando muito um débito de água reduzido no QB -mas explicado que é por uma boa causa : POUPAR ÁGUA
pros: LA UBICACION cons:
pros: Muy tranquilo buenas instalaciones bien situado personal encantador y el mejor restaurante de toda la zona cons:

pros: Qualidade do pequeno -almoço.
Limpeza e conforto. cons: Travesseiros de cama demasiado altos
pros: Nos gustó la ubicación del hotel; muy céntrico. cons:
pros: História localização ótimo serviço conforto cons: Suco de laranja no Algarve estava péssimo! Não havia um quarto triplo.

pros: Tudo estava perfeito.  O meu marido fazia anos e foi presenteado com uma surpresa. 
O quarto era grande e confortável. 
Pequeno almoço muito variado. 
Instalações surpreendentes e pessoal amabilissimo. cons:
pros: Ótimo café da manhã excelente localização linda decoração. cons: Tamanho do quarto e lugar para colocar malas
pros: Local muito bonito e bem localizado. cons: Pressão da água no chuveiro não era muito forte.

pros: Edificio emblemático muy bien situado. Instalaciones adaptadas al edificio original  muy conservado. Camas súper confortables y habitación al estilo Parador y Edf emblemáticos . El desayuno muy variado y peticiones de huevos fritos servidos en mesa. cons: El precio del Gin en el bar  que cobran aparte el refresco del combinado  nos pareció carísimo 37 euros 2 Gin tonic  porque tampoco tenían refresco de limón . El mismo precio que el Cataplana en el restaurante … eso fue exagerado la verdad
pros: La exquisita atención del personal. El regalo de cumpleaños que nos enviaron a la habitación al comprobar por el DNI que era el cumpleaños de uno de la pareja. cons:
pros: Todo cons: Nada

pros: Maravillosas instalaciones. Personal amable y atento. Limpieza perfecta. No puedo decir nafa malo. Pues aunque tuvimos un problema con una ventana que no se abría no nos supuso un problema insalvable. cons:
pros: El hotel es muy bonito y la zona de la piscina es preciosa. La habitación es amplia y muy cómoda. El personal de recepción ha sido sumamente amable. El desayuno es excepcional. cons:
pros:  cons: Faltan enchufes mesilla noche
pros: Simpatia de todo o staff e localização cons:
pros:  cons: Apesar de muito prestáveis havia poucos empregados ao pequeno-almoço o que fez com que durante vários períodos não houvesse nenhum em sala.
pros: La ubicación y amabilidad del personal. cons:
pros: El claustro del convento ahora reconvertido en hotel lugar de paz y de relajación en la hora del desayuno. cons: En la habitación le faltaba otro aire acondicionado o uno más potente

pros: A simpatia é profissionalismo dos empregados e do serviço prestado.
A localização era excelente! cons:
pros: Excepcional en todos sus departamentos.  El personal a cargo del establecimiento es extraordinario. cons:
pros: El edificio histórico la ubicación e instalaciones. Además del restaurante. cons: El agua de la alberca es fría.

pros: La atención del personal
Las referencias históricas y su ambientación cons:

pros: Ótima localização e conforto cons:

pros: Es un hotel precioso magníficamente ubicado y con detalles en la habitación que resultan muy gratos. El restaurante igualmente estupendo cons:

pros: La habitación  muy limpiaalmohadas confortables y personal atento y amable.
Desayuno variado y abundante. cons:
pros: se preocupan de todo cons:

pros: Em geral tudo correu bem. Gostei muito da forma como foram preservados e integrados elementos históricos. cons: O serviço do restaurante era demorado . Pessoal muito simpático e amável mas que pelos vistos não chegava para as encomendas.
pros: Bom cons: Não estava identificado o responsável pela instalação hoteleira e pela liderança na gestão!

pros: Gosto muito desta pousada. Desta vez gostei ainda mais pois o quarto era muito espaçoso a casa de banho enorme e tudo muito arrumado e limpo. A varanda era um must pois era quase privada. Nada a apontar tudo foi bom. O pequeno almoço bom como sempre e agora tem carregamento carros eletricos no parque privativo. cons: Sinceramente não consigo apontar nada. Correu tudo muito bem sem reparos.

pros: O pequeno almoço era fantástico com muitas opções para todos os gostos. O quarto era muito espaçoso e muito bem tratado sendo que os acabamentos eram de muito boa qualidade. Ótimo isolamento. Os funcionários foram sempre muito disponíveis e simpáticos. Levámos um pequeno cão que foi recebido com uma caixa de snacks e ração de muito boa qualidade. Adorámos a estadia. cons: Levámos um pequeno cão connosco e teria sido mais fácil se a tivéssemos podido trazer connosco às zonas exteriores - área da piscina e zona de pequeno almoço exterior. Os cães estão proibidos de estar na zona da piscina (mesmo que estejam fora dela) e no pátio central que tem num dos lados uma zona de bar/pequeno almoço exterior. Ainda assim receberam-no muito bem.
pros: Estancia extraordinaria y personal muy amable cons:
pros: Do atendimento cons: A internet do apartamento estava horrível sem condições de utilização.
pros: Local agradável cons: Poderia ter pantufas nos quartos e cama de casal
pros: Café da manhã extraordinário. Localização ótima. cons: wi fi

pros: La situación cons: Los colchones necesitan ya un cambio son viejos y no se descansa bien. No es de recibo sobre todo costando lo que cuesta la habitación.
El constante ruido de las puertas de las habitaciones
pros: Perfecto cons:
pros: buena atención con nosotros y nuestra mascota cons:
pros:  cons: cama antigua

pros: La Pousada es un espacio bellissimo y echo con muchísimo gusto muy bien situada en un entorno tranquilo y céntrico. Lo que más apreciamos fue el trato recibido por Daniela Andrea y Edy que nos acogieron y cuidaron de una manera muy especial. Además tienen un cuidado buenísimo con las mascotas. cons: nada
pros: Equipe maravilhosa. Cozinha maravilhosa. cons:
pros: Localização do edifício do convento bem recuperado do conforto. cons: Serviço mínimo simpático mas meio amador

pros: Me gustaría destacar al metre Sandro. Con mucha diferencia un servicio excepcional.
Ubicación al lado del castillo sensacional. cons: Hubo un par de detalles que no me gustaron

pros: Pequeno almoço bom (mas não óptimo) cons: Má sinalização dos acessos entre os quartos - recepção - sala de jantar - etc.
A sinalização indica a existência dum Living Room com lareira e não existe nem uma coisa nem outra. Apenas um corredor com fogão a lenha que não funciona nem é operacional com uns cadeirões ao lado onde não "apetece estar".
Não encontrámos nenhuma sala onde nos pudéssemos sentar a ler nem serviço de bar

pros: Edifício.
Localizacao cons: O quarto!
Os serviços de apoio a piscina e do pequeno almoço. Este último com boa vontade mas claramente insuficiente para o nível da pousada.
O Serviço da recepção e o único competente.
pros: Calidad de la comida en el restaurante pero hay falta de camareros y la espera es larguísima! cons: No ha suficientes empleados para tanto hotel
pros: Lacalizacion cons: Falta personal para ayudar con las maletas falta personal para el restaurante faltan plegados en todas partes!

pros: a limpeza do quarto extraordinária funcionários da recepção o resto bem mais muito novos. cons: o pequeno almoço poco variado
o bater de portas foi horrível cada vez alguém fechava a porta esta batia com muita força fazendo um gran desconforto.
pros: o sítio histórico bem preservado e decorado . cons: o colchão da cama muito muito desconfortável .

pros: Gostei do pequeno almoço e a pousada tem boa localização. cons: Gosto de cama de casal e não de duas camas individuais juntas.
Os cortinados eram apenas de blackout portanto de manhã tínhamos de estar com a luz acesa sem poder abrir o cortinado porque o nosso quarto era no 1 andar e dava para um pátio onde havia pessoas.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Wonderful stay for my husbands birthday. The breakfast buffet was fantastic with many options all delicious. We had a lovely meal at the restaurant for dinner the food was great. 
Staff were helpful and pleasant. cons: Difficult to reach the resort from the main road by car and was scary particularly at night. better lighting to illuminate the way and signs would help!

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful property very peaceful and tastefully designed. Luxury without being stuffy. cons: The spa is very nice but quite small- being able to book a slot was sometimes a challenge. We were happy there was a specific timeframe for children to access with the remainder of the time being adults only.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Love the location been back many times beautiful rooms and views cons: Spa was too busy to use no hot water in the spa shower and we weren’t informed the hot water wasn’t working before we came in

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. A beautiful location very tranquil and relaxed. Everything was perfect. cons: The food in the restaurant is excellent including the vegetarian options however there could be more choice for vegetarian main courses.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Lovely location and excellent staff cons: Nothing

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Funky architecture cons: Distance to our room. Long walk!

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: amazing place really nice staff breakfast is very tasty. I would highly recommend. cons: S could be more accessible for handicaps and less slippery

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The hotel is situated in the heart of the Costa Vicentina Natural Park offering a peaceful and nature-surrounded retreat. Architecturally the construction is well thought out providing guests with a sense of privacy and space while respecting the natural surroundings. The rooms and bathrooms are of a high standard although the mattresses could be improved. The bar and lobby are very cosy and the cocktails do not disappoint. Breakfast is in keeping with the standard of the hotel with good produce and well-prepared food (although the service could be quicker and more attentive). I would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are not scared to drive through dirt and gravel roads oddly it seems to bother many people i thought it was quite refreshing. Staff is extremely attentive and always keen to help and facilitate. cons: The quality of the mattress could be better and the service in the restaurant could be a bit more efficient. On both days during my stay i had to go through 3 salt and pepper shakers to get some salt or pepper. Once seated guests should be asked about bread and coffee seeing these need to be brought to you from the kitchen. these are minor points and I am only really raising them so provide feedback as i do think this hotel has the potential to impress and delight most guests

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Spa is excellent and the staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel is modern and comfortable. cons: Nothing!

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: It was in a stunning and remote location cons: Nothing

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: It is placed in an amazing location- no other hotels and facilities. Architecture is beautiful and the vibe gives you a lot of peace 
There are yoga class in the morning with wonderful Sofia! Great breakfast and super nice staff. cons: This was our second stay and we saw a little bit of things that didn’t work as well as the first stay however the hotel manager listened to the feedback and responded to it with care which is the most important. This made us feel appreciated and we will come back whenever time allows. 
Special thanks to Bruno Selina and Bellboy who are truly amazing!

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Quiet beautiful location cons: Nothing

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The breakfast is top quality and the staff were very friendly. A big thank you to Melanie (front desk)  and Sasha (bartender) for their impeccable service. The room is clean and spacious we had a nice view from our little terrace. Esteva Spa is definitely a must-do. Room service also very thoughtful and quick. It can get a little cold but they have heating system in the rooms that keeps it a very nice temperature. Very comfy beds and pillows. We wouldn't change anything about the rooms. cons: Unfortunately for us there had been a big group before our check in perhaps wedding guests. This resulted in less attention of detail and care going into the rest of the hotel guests such as ton of dirty towels around pool area not being cleaned up same in the spa area lunch area not prepared on time so we had to wait but nothing was too major we still enjoyed our time there. The next day was better as the big groups had left. After that everything seemed calmer and better organized.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World

reviewText:
pros: We highly enjoyed our stay here the room size was so good  the bed was extra comfortable and the room was so clean . The resort it self so nice and the staff are extra nice .. especially jonathen in the restaurant big thanks to him . And the food waa amazing cons: My big disappointment was the spa is this is a high standard resort the spa doesn’t meat this standard… 
The entrance to the resort a bit confusing and difficult wish if there were a sign for the proper entrance

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything was amazing the place the hotel is situated the staff the hotel itself was great! cons: The access is not great to the hotel since it’s situated inside the natural park the public roads are made of dirt and there were some holes something that is not responsibility of the hotel but it is of the municipality that should take care of these roads in order to value the companies that bring visitants there. Nevertheless we had an amazing week at the hotel and the road didn’t affect at all our week plans.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This is one of our favorite hotels and that's why we stayed here for the third time. The architecture blends with the rugged and beautiful protected landscape. PDCR improved a couple of things especially the new bungalow by the pool where lunch and dinner is served. The staff rooms and food are impeccable. We will be back cons: -

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The resort is fabulous. cons: The only negative point is the evening restaurant. The food is ok-is with a very limited menu. There is no ambience - no music - quite dull which is a pity as the restaurant looks great. Also staff could be quicker in general.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent food and great location. Very beautiful environment stunning views and fantastics walks on the resort and to praia de canal. Great swimming pool and beds to relax. Rooms are excellent. Very friendly staff (although not qualified for the job - see below). cons: Service was poor at breakfast lunch and dinner (except for the bar in the main building where the service was excellent). Food and drinks arrived late in the wrong order or not at all which is a shame because this seriously affects the rating of this excellent resort. You should really do something about this otherwise you are going to lose customers.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: It was one of the nicest resorts we’ve ever enjoyed. Wonderful grounds and views. A must to come stay at again! cons: N/A

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: I'm from Portugal and this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in Portugal! The hotel is absolutely stunning - the decoration and ambience are amazing. The facilities were perfect- room was spacious pool area is well kept and has towels/water the spa had a great vibe. We had some of the most delicious food ever- for dinner I would highly recommend eating the 'Carabineiro Rice'! cons: The area can be slightly windy so sometimes it was a little cool to go in the pool water! But besides that absolutely perfect and would highly recommend to everyone!

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything! Very beautiful retreat. Exceptional architecture very tasteful decoration very nice pool and spa. In the middle of nature. cons:

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The photos don't do the place justice. Incredibly beautiful (architecturally and the nature around). Besides that the Breakfast and terrific staff round up this gorgeous place. Dhiraj and Bruno at reception plus Andre and Selina at the restaurant warmed us up with their hospitality. cons: The opening hours/capacity for the spa and that we stayed so little so we chose to discover the towns/beaches around but didn't make the most of the hotel itself.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This hotel is absolutely fantastic. However staff should pay more atention to breakfast time. Waiting 30 min for the order in not acceptable even on holiday. Still I give it 5*. cons:

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Very nice remote location great environment cons: Nothing

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: We had a lovely stay at Praia do Canal although the service levels aren’t quite at the level they should be for a 5 star hotel. 
The rooms hotel grounds and facilities are excellent. The design of the whole hotel is beautiful and it has so many fantastic touches in all the public areas. It’s also very peaceful and set in gorgeous and extensive grounds. cons: The staff are lovely and really keen to provide great service but I think there must be a training or management issue as we frequently found the service to be slow and a bit disorganised especially at our last dinner when it was quite poor. The food was very nice when it arrived. Service at breakfast was a lot slicker. I would also say that there were some really good staff particularly in the bar where Sasha is a delight.
Our other comment would be the noise from the garden maintenance team during our stay. As I said the grounds are beautiful and so will need maintaining but the beautiful peace and tranquility that is a feature of the hotel was frequently interrupted by petrol-powered strimmers and the sound of other power tools during the day.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful location well designed cozy spa nice views and nice food cons: Being part of small luxury hotels they missed a mark on a few things. First and foremost it was a surprise stay for me and my wife as we were coming here straight after our wedding. I mentioned it twice to the hotel through booking com to see if it is possible to make any arrangements for a room / decoration or anything else. I also mentioned that we do not drink alcohol. Upon arrival none of the staff acknowledged the special occasion the room had a welcome bottle of Prosecco… this is where we a small luxury hotel I expect it to be able to give more attention to those details 

2) you must book your restaurant for dinner one night I called at 7pm and the only slot they had for 9:15 despite it being a small property with a pretty big restaurant (I assume staffing is a limitation). Would not be an issue in most places but here the closest restaurants are 15min away on a road full of potholes

3) our bath had dirty water however luckily the maintenance guy managed to resolve it relatively quickly

So overall a nice hotel but missing the mark on hospitality

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Aesthetic of the property is simply amazing
Kindness and availability of employees
Gardens are astonishing cons: Very poor food and beverage choice quantity
Housekeeping department

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The property surroundings are amazing pure wild nature. The rooms are spacious private and quiet. cons: The access road could be in better condition.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Absolutely beautiful hotel and surrounds. We loved the rural location and the local walking/ hiking trails. We were well fuelled by a generous & expansive breakfast offering great lunch choices & dinners. 

After exercising we thoroughly enjoyed the pool and spa areas. The lady front of house in the spa was an absolute delight. Everyone should aspire to deliver her level of personal service (remembering names time preferences etc.). She made our trip! 

Overall a wonderful stay we’d definitely visit again. cons: Two minor points:
1. They need to offer fries with lunch/ dinner. Vegetable crisps from a packet are no good (even if made by the chef).
2. Better filling of pot holes at least at the hotel entrance.


Bigger complaint- sound proofing. We were in a ground floor suite and we could hear the people above us. This needs to be sorted.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Modern luxury retreat with excellent service! cons: Nothing to think of

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: I recently had the most wonderful getaway at this hotel. The experience was truly exceptional. The property is not only beautiful but also unique offering a serene and picturesque environment. Every corner of the hotel exudes charm and elegance.

One of the highlights of my stay was the dinner. It was an absolute delight for the senses with each dish meticulously prepared and bursting with flavor. The culinary experience was simply unforgettable.

Overall it was a dream vacation and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and relaxing escape. cons: However the journey to the hotel was quite adventurous. Improved signage along the way would be greatly appreciated to make the arrival smoother. This is a detail and will be forgotten upon arrival.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World

reviewText: pros: Lovely hotel great complementary event on arrival day - we took part in a great wine tasting. reviewText:

Restaurant menu would be limited for a vegetarian.

reviewText:
pros: Very spacious setup of hotel and its facilities. Big pool are and bar setting in nature and the views and tranquility. Staff were super helpful friendly and authentic in their way of sevicing. Very nice rooms with spacious bathroom and bacony. Extensive breakfast with multitude of nice options. cons: We stayed on the 1st floor room of the cubicle we were in and could hear neighbours beneath us speak meaning the isolation is not great but nothing really disturbing. 

We would advice to have some kind of blinding for the window in the bathroom that is not privacy proof when walking out of the shower.

hotelName: Praia do Canal Nature Retreat- Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Very natural design high quality furniture and natural materials everywhere. Very enjoying for the esthetic eye.

Great location middle in the nature nice hiking roots to the ocean. The arrival is not dramatic at all if you take the right root. Spacious and good equipped gym big parking lots. 

Great restaurants in the are of 15-20m drive. 

Spa area is also pretty and is heaven 
as long as you are alone there. 

Great cappuccino at breakfast.

Very good wifi everywhere. 

Very warm reception with champagne. cons: On the first day the spa was closed - because we were the only guest in the entire hotel. So I am pretty sure they could not be bothered to keep it open for 2 people only. Very disappointing when you only have 3 days. 

Also no possibility to borrow a bike for couple of hours. Being alone in the entire hotel we still had an option to either rent it for a half a day or a full day only. I understand this policy in summer but in February when you are alone there hmmm.

Spa is small and has 4 beds only but during my last day 9 people were in there so was chaotic. Screaming kid in the spa - adult only would be appropriate. Steam room was closed the shoe time. 

Breakfast is dominated by gluten.

We were pleasantly surprised with a welcome wine and delightful chocolates each evening. The intimate boutique spa added to the overall allure. Our experience was truly enjoyable and we look forward to returning. Gratitude to the entire hotel team for their attentive care. P.s breakfast is incredible! cons:
