hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: A very special place location  decor  surroundings and beautiful food cons: No complaints

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Very friendly staff great service
A delicious welcome drink
A spacious room
Easy parking close to entrance
Nice lounge area to enjoy a drink
Good breakfast
Beautiful building cons: No sockets near bed or on the desk
No socket in the bathroom. Receptionist told us it was forbidden in Portugal but we had a socket in the bathroom in every other Portuguese hotel.
The white furniture in the room looked quite cheap and awful.
The classic chairs in the lounge were tired looking and uncomfortable.
We found it very strange to see the reception in the chapel while there seemed to be a much better reception area which was used for Roman artifacts from a museum.
Large bedrooms with no atmosphere and dated design.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Amazing property great staff cons: Restaurante needs some improvement

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Amazing place. Great modern wing of the hotel.
Great breakfast. cons: The restaurant dinner was over promising and overpriced.
Had to wait and search for the staff at the checkin desk which was empty for almost 20mins.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Location and breakfast was superb. cons: Dinner is overpriced.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The staff was very nice.
Best hotel breakfast and best hotel coffee we've ever had. We loved the indoor swimming pool. cons: The system to open the wardrobes  hurt my fingers every time but this is so minor

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent quality breakfast and dinner alike . All staff were extremely welcoming and helpful and the property was beautiful with an exceptional view. cons: A bit more information about the history of the palace and the surrounds would improve the understanding of the surroundings. Some music while dining and breakfast would improve the experience.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The room had a balcony with a view of the sea far away. The pousada’s historic rooms were gorgeously appointed and offers amazing views of the gardens. The covered parking garage was excellent giving direct access to the rooms. cons: The rooms were in an annex so it’s a very modern section compared to the old palace. Some rooms were very visible from the street.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Room space. The environement  and  outside view cons: The Rooms were  cleaned at end of afternoon

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: great historical building - great breakfast cons: I have nothing to note

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Amazing experience to stay in such an unusual hotel. We loved the architecture and the gardens. The swimming pool was lovely and breakfast was fantastic. Great location for the airport. cons: Nothing.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: LOVED the historic palace the reception rooms the exterior all Amazing but then you have a Fabulous accommodation wing with first class rooms very sound proofed. Pools were super plenty of beds to lounge on cons: Steam room kept powering off spa receptionist would put back on but sometimes she was doing treatments but frustrating there wasn’t a switch outside the steam room door

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: I loved the high standards of hospitality & excellence in every aspect of the hotel. I highly recommend at least a 2 night visit to the hotel. The attention to detail space is hard to match & the breakfast was 10 star. We have rebooked for the night before we fly out from Faro. cons: The Hotel Reception in the Old Chapel felt dark & oppressive.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: lovely interior of castle and gardens cons: Exterior is worn; no where to plug curling iron in near and outlet

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The mash up of the old Palace and modern hotel. The staff were very friendly cons: No teaspoons at breakfast but staff got them immediately

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Friendly helpful staff beautiful building. Away from the crowds. Great breakfast and perfect spots for a drink to watch the sunset. cons: A bit run down in areas. Rooms were spacious but nothing special as they are in a modern block next to the Palace. Views were okay but long grasses by the outside areas made it look scruffy and unkept.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Amazing and beautiful cons: N/a

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent : cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Lovely and attentive staff. Beautiful hotel superb staff in a very calm setting. Absolutely superb. cons: Nothing!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: All facilities were excellent and staff superb cons: The only service that was not exemplary was the bar within the Palace which was largely unstaffed and very slow. Not a massive problem when everything else was fantastic.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: I like that the hotel is small and away from the touristy bit of the Algarve. cons: My only warning is that the weddings can be a bit of an inconvenience. There were three when I was there. The first two - Liverpool and then Irish - were fine. The last one was a very large group of Flemish speaking Belgians. They were incredibly loud and spent the time around the pool shouting at each other. Left pool towels and glasses strewn all over the place. Not relaxing at all when they were there  and they were there for three days. I get that the weddings are good business but .......

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything! cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Very good staff thank you. cons: Nothing thank you.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Hotel room the architecture the art and definitely the breakfast! That in combination with a great staff can only result in the best. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The bedrooms were excellent cons: The shower was not great  the pool bar staff disorganised

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: It is a fantastic hotel the staff are amazing the whole place is perfect in every way cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: We have used this property 3 times now. It is important for me to know that it is going to be clean comfortable and the staff very professional. This hotel is super. Each stay has been great and I wiukd recommend it to anyone wanting a 5 star property in this area if the Algarve. cons: The bed mattress is a little on the firm side.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: O requinte! cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The friendliness of the staff the pool and its setting within a unique place was really special. The breakfasts were varied delicious and generous. Room was comfortable staff responsive and WiFi worked well. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Loved the old world feeling of the hotel and the modern bedrooms. Very relaxing great pool area and superb restaurant. Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Amazing location. 
The breakfast staff very kind and the service was fast and precise. The room where taken clean and tidy. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The breakfast had the most outstanding range of choices I have ever seen all delicious.

Pool was lovely and having the option of the small indoor pool/ jacuzi was lovely to get out of the hot sun. Our room was perfect as they had upgraded us to give us more space which was very kind of them. cons: Other dinners smoking on the outside terrace / eating area so we were able to move inside for desert but found overall in Portugal smoking seemed more common.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Lovely room with plenty of space and comfortable spacious beds.  Beautiful grounds!  Very quiet at night.  Good location. Nice to sit outside on terrace with a drink at night and also for breakfast. cons: Breakfasts were ok but would have liked more choice for the English cooked breakfast as was limited in food choices.  Also would have liked hot freshly cooked pancakes but was ok for continental breakfast.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The history architecture grounds amenities fabulous breakfast parking garage and how close it is to the major highway A22 cons: The thermostat was a little funky to understand. It turned off on its own and when we got back from our daily adventures it was quite warm. I also wished there was a separate small fridge besides the mini bar fridge. Not a dealbreaker but good to know if you plan on buying waters and want to keep them cold.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything was great from the staff friendliness to the amenities food and pool. Great service! cons: water pressure was a bit low for the shower but nothing we could not manage.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The staff and breakfast cons: The gardens and outside area are really bad. Very overgrown. Also loads of stray cats the are around your feet in the restaurant. Employees do not chase them away. Not good for 5 star hotel. Dionísio Pestana would be 😱

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Quite a unique hotel it was like staying at the museum overall very positive impression - don’t pay to much attention to improvement points :) cons: Not much to complain about- a few minor observations:
1. For a 5-star hotel some renovation is needed here and there
2. A bit odd having to additionally ask for a bathrobe
3. At breakfast having to take a cup from the  table where you are seated to go to another room to pour tea or coffee 
4. Sauna was slightly warm and hammam not working in spite of reception convincing us all was on

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Incredible architecture. It's like staying in a work of art. The location and view are superb. Beautiful gardens. Great swimming pool. Breakfast was delicious. The rooms were so comfortable – huge beds. cons: I would have liked to have been given a room with a nicer view which I requested. Although I understand it might not have been possible at the time. My room overlooked some bushes.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: stunning setting lush staying in amongst 2000 years of history staff are great cons: nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: It’s fantastic an awesome place staff outstanding cons: Everything about it perfect

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Spacious and comfortable rooms very nice staff spectacular architecture cons: Disappointing lack of an iron in the room Laundry services are available but the immediate convenience of an iron is something I expect.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Staff very nice and always available to support
The hotel is very nice and swimming pool very good and clean
Breakfast is very good cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Lovely friendly service from check in to check out. Spacious comfortable rooms. Restaurant meal good quality and excellent value. Hotel facilities great. cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything cons: Lack of some menu choices

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Wonderful place. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The art and delicious breakfast cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The staff and the premises cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: very beautiful cons: everything was amazing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The pool facilities were excellent.  The bar was goos. The restaurant was ok but a bit informal cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful building with great history but really modern bedrooms and facilities.  Lovely gardens and grounds and super terrace for outdoor dining. cons: Staff struggled to cope when events like weddings were on. And bedrooms weren't made up until late afternoon.  But didn't spoil our experience.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Loved the historic value of the property.   Enjoyed relaxing by the beautiful pool.  Many amenities to take advantage of. cons: N/a

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The location is stunning the palace is spectacularly renovated and the rooms are beautifully designed to be comfortable practical and welcoming. cons: We liked everything!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was incredible view and location incredible grounds and gardens incredible room clean and nice and beds comfy. cons: Nothing. We loved everything

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: History and staff cons: Location is a little off the beaten path

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros:  cons: wi fi did not have password protection I had to use my roaming plan

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The reception rooms were spectacular - we felt like we were in a palace. The swimming pool and its surrounding area were very pleasant. The gardens and exterior decor were very attractive. cons: Even though the gardens were attractive some extra weeding and cleaning would have improved the appearance. The bathroom door was stiff and did not close easily.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This is a fantastic ex-palace.  The reception and main rooms are exquisite.   You can use any of the main rooms any time although the chairs being in keeping with the period are not that comfortable LOL.  Great ambience.  Excellent pool (getting a pool towel on the other hand more of a challenge!).  Basic gym.  Outstanding breakfast.  Easy parking.  Excellent staff.  We loved our stay here (we stayed in a superior view room on the 2nd floor with a terrace looking down to Faro (and a lot of grass).  Yes the building is VERY OLD which means that in a few places the paint is peeling etc.  There was also some refurbishment work done in the reception (old chapel ) while we were there.  This did nothing to detract from my enjoyment but if you worry about that sort of thing don't stay. cons: View from terrace is good but the grass gets in the way a bit.  Getting a pool towel was a challenge - apparently I should have told them that I wanted the one in the room replaced after it was taken away (seriously?  some people stay for a week and don't want it replaced??????).

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: I enjoyed the pool area and the rooms were spacious. cons: I would have liked rooms with a view. I booked two rooms and feel we should have had a view.
Service from the bar while relaxing on the patio was slow as was dinner service. They need to hire more staff.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The rooms were AMAZING . LARGE  perhaps the largest bedroom I've ever had with giant bathrooms.  Even a complementary shoe polishing kit.

The breakfast was the best hotel breakfast I've had in my life - mimosas fresh cheeses freshly baked bread and pastry (in a tiny village)

The swimming pool with the VIEW was out of this world and I had it all to myself all day on Christmas Day.  there is a small heated indoor pool and sauna / Turkish bath.  I generally don't fancy those facilities but they were terrific

I was able to enjoy the Roman ruins in the near by and the small museum was a thrill.  Art Works were along the large corridors.  It was more than a hotel - it was a hotel with a connection to local history.

Of course the original building and gardens were terrific and it was lovely to stay someplace so fancy.

the staff couldn't have been more helpful.  Everybody did their best and worked through Christmas without complaint

I typically don't go back to the same place twice but if I would ever revisit a hotel it would be this treasure.  The place is actually nicer than the photos presented (many of the guests though the photos didn't do it justice) cons: to plug in my lap top I had to craw underneath the desk to find the plug socket.   

The best bedrooms are on the higher floors (better view) and I began to wonder if solo travellers were allocated lower floors rooms automatically.  Another solo traveller must have researched the hotel better than I and when he was allocated a similar room to me he asked to be moved to a room with a view (I checked in late and night).  I paid the same for my room as any couple paid to share their room but I'm conscious that people might have a bias in favour of couples (people who are in a couple might think giving a couple a room with a better view is acceptable).  I didn't think to raise this on check out but I booked my room in September.  Many others booked in December.   Surely the rooms with the better views would be allocated on a first come / first served basis?  As a solo traveller I'm very conscious that there is a strange sense of entitlement benefiting domesticated couples .

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast is spectacular! We have traveled all over the world and we would rank this breakfast as a 10! The sauna was a great perk and was most enjoyable near by our room. cons: No coffee maker in the room.  Since we are early risers and the breakfast room doesn't open until 8 am we found it disappointing not having coffee in our room.  This property is located in a very tiny country town so there isn't an option to go to a cafe or coffee shop either.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: What a lovely place everything so carefully arranged wonderful room with very spacy and comfy bed and bathroom. We loved the pool the surroundings and the excellent breakfast in the morning. cons: Nothing everything was absolutly wonderful

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: What a beautiful and unique hotel! We loved exploring the grounds and gardens. The hotel was pretty quiet when we were there (November) and felt like we had it to ourselves which we loved. The breakfast really was exceptional and had us set for our day. Everything was clean and comfortable. The pool and steam/sauna rooms were such a lovely treat! The hotel staff were very kind and attentive. We appreciated the little details such as having water and apple to take on our way out the door.

There were options to dine within a short drive and plenty to see and do along the coast very close by. cons: We wish the pool steam/sauna rooms were open a little later so we could have enjoyed after a day of exploring the area!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful old palace gorgeous estate cons: All the fixtures are some 20 years back. Location - middle of nowhere 20 min drive to any restaurant (except for the hotel’s one) or other signs pf civilisation

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: They aren't joking when they call it a palacio! Stunning building beautiful gardens plenty of breakfast choices and lovely staff. Perfect for a quiet weekend away and just 20 minutes drive from the airport. cons: There is very little in Estoi village so if you want to eat out or go for drinks you will need to go to Faro or one of the adjoining towns. Overall the quality of the hotel was good although it was a touch shabby in places (didn't affect our stay in the slightest). Perfect for a quiet weekend but if you're staying for longer than that or looking for vibrant nightlife then this probably isn't the place for you.

We stayed with our dog and she was presented with a beautiful dog gift box with food and treats for her.
The staff also are extremely kind and friendly and helpful. cons: The mattress is hard and the gardens could be a little better maintained.
The outdoor pool was closed for maintenance. The steam room was not working.

reviewText: pros: Staff were absolutely exceptional really friendly kind and helpful. I couldn't fault them. A personalised welcome card and fruit bowl in our room were a lovely touch. Breakfast was amazing and I thought very good value. A lovely village and interesting building made for a real treat. Thank you. cons: I thought it would have been nice to have tea/coffee in our room but that's just something I'm used to I think being from the UK. It's certainly not a problem.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The grounds and property are magnificent beautiful views all around great sense of history quaint village but not much to see cons: The rooms need a serious upgrade of furniture and decor
They are spacious but need refurbishment 
Mattress very hard and springs coming through 
Common areas like patio pool deck and restaurant patio are beautiful
Pool is very shallow all over so that is bizarre 
Palacio areas are old and need upkeep/refresh and renovations even if historical 
Access to and from the hotel to any other destination is a little convoluted and can be dangerous in night 
Uber is relatively cheap (approx 15euros) to Faro or Loulé and better option for evening outings

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The staff were excellent. The buffet breakfast was great. cons: The gardens were disappointing. They could be beautiful but there is a lack of maintenance with box hedges overgrown many weeds and some broken water features. There were a dozen or more round table tops dumped at the back of one of the gardens.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: I booked Pousada Palacio de Estoi for a single night because we arrived in Faro on a flight a day earlier than a villa stay started to avoid airport strikes.  I was just looking for a comfortable stop over for me and my family. Based on the price and the photos on Booking.com I wasn't expecting anything particularly special. However Pousada Palacio de Estoi delivered a luxury experience and level of surface that really exceeded my expectations.   The photos don't do the hotel justice - it's a mix of modern and historic and both feel very well kept and upscale.  I was impressed by the staff - at the front desk pool side and at breakfast - who delivered the kind of professional and attentive service you'd expect from a hotel charging double.  We requested a late checkout.  The hotel couldn't accommodate that but let us use the facilities - like the wonderful pool area - for as long as we wanted on checkout day. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: A beautiful and historic building with interesting communal areas and gardens. The bedrooms are in a modern extension and are very comfortable. The restaurant has lovely views of the area and had a good selection so we ate there a few times. cons: The access road is a little narrow and the surrounding village is quite sleepy. But the hotel itself has plenty of parking.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This hotel was indeed luxurious beautiful and stunning. The view alone blows your breath away. The staff were amazing. The people there we very friendly. It is in a weird location but it's safe and comfortable. The Gardens there were gorgeous. You get 3 experiences in 1 history luxury and royalty. The food was excellent as well. I would definitely recommend. I went for my birthday with my partner and child but there was a variety of age groups there. The staff did make it extra special. cons: Just the initial outside and the road as you approach could do with a little improvement.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The staff were lovely and really helpful.  Breakfasts were good and there was a lot of choice.  Comfortable sitting area in the main building and on the verandah. cons: We were put in one of the furtherest rooms on the 1st floor and the walk from the room to the main part of the hotel was a long way for us.  For the price we also felt that there should have been coffee/tea facilities in the room. A observation on the pool area -we felt that more could be done to make it more pleasant ie the use of plants in pots to soften the landscape.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful hotel blending an old palace and gardens with new accommodation in an exceptional way.  The staff were friendly helpful and kind throughout the hotel. Our room was well appointed and spacious with a lovely terrace and garden view. There was a great breakfast selection and the restaurant setting was really lovely. The pool and sauna were easy to access from our room and were very well maintained.Finally the underground car park was a great bonus and we knew that our car was secure at the end of each day.
The gardens of the palace are magnificent 
and the village of Estoi is charming and is an authentic Poetugese village. The Church in the square is magnificent! cons: The entrance street to the hotel doesn't create a great first impression for its guests. It's a great pity that the authorities in the Town can't jointly make improvements here along with the Pestana Group. It's shortsighted of the powers that be in the town not to realise that investment in this infrastructure would be a good investment as the town benefits so much from having this beautiful hotel at its centre.
