reviewText: pros: Gorgeous building friendly staff who were happy to engage and lots of interesting artefacts and information across the hotel.  The views were amazing and the gorgeous gardens are well worth a visit.   Lovely quiet surroundings huge bathroom with a very powerful shower.  Everything was well thought out huge bath sheets different sized pillows and even a personalised welcome on the TV screen in our room - great touch!   Would happily recommend and stay again! cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: unusual comfortable luxurious. cons: nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful historic property!!! Enjoyed dinner and the pools / sauna. Definitely worth visiting nearby Roman ruins see the pieces on display in the hotel lobby. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Talk about unique!  We were there in the winter so it was too cold to use the incredible outdoor pool but the rooms were comfortable and spending the evenings I. the palace rooms watching the World Cup and drinking wine were fantastic. cons: It was a long walk to our room and the locations isn’t really walking distance to much but we had a car so it wasn’t an issue.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: I liked everything  from my initial email conversations which were prompt and informative .
Our room upgrade  I had some special requests for the room  these were taken care of and even more done that what I had asked for .
Room was absolutely amazing  if you can stay in the suite  you won't be disappointed..
Breakfast was super wide selection of foods to suit everyone.
INdoor pool and spa area were spotles . cons: I didn't like the fact  that I was only available   to stay at this wonderful hotel for 1 nite .

One nite isn't enough 😥😥😥

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: very beautiful palace cons: The food in the restaurant did not match the rest of the experience

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: I loved my stay at the Pousada Palacio de Estoi - it’s the perfect combination of being very well run and luxurious whilst having a relaxed and welcoming feel. All the staff were so friendly and happy to help the room was spacious very comfortable and so quiet with a lovely view from the terrace. The temperature of the room was just right I didn’t have to adjust the aircon at all. I had to do some work during my stay and it was a nice place to work from with good wifi. Breakfast is amazing and plentiful. The grounds are beautiful and the town is very charming and quiet but with everything you need. If I win the lottery I might come spend the whole winter at this hotel 😉 cons: Having to leave!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: A stunningly renovated palace. Staff was great. Breakfast buffet was over the top! cons: all good!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This is a gorgeous and elegant restored palace. it’s stunning. The breakfast buffet is top rate and offers everything and it is delicious. The staff is attentive and helpful and polite. cons: all good!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Extremly nice staff. Beautiful building. Comfortable room with huhe bed. Breakfast has been by far the best one durinh our 12 day journey across Portugal and Andalucia. cons: Nothinh

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Pleasant staff and beautiful old house. Excellent restaurant for diiner and breakfast catering for all tastes. Views excellent. cons: Hated the modern soulless annex which jared with the beautiful palacio.. Equally soulless rooms. 
Entering the chapel where the reception is means navigating steps squeezing through narrow doorway with more steps not allowing for wheelchair and having to carry luggage endlessly with help of receptionist. Stayed in room 10 which is near swimmingpool so probably noisy in the summertime.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful and unique building with all the facilities of a high class hotel. Staff were friendly polite and helpful. Good restaurant for dining and an excellent breakfast buffet. cons: I found nothing to dislike.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros:  cons: Restaurant was poor

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Really appreciated the marriage of the old building with the modern hotel part that was built into the hillside. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Loved the charming hotel the staff the amazing breakfast the surrounding area the food the atmosphere...
It was a wonderful experience. cons: Nothing to report.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: pretty unique property with original period furnishings in the shared areas. Felt quite cosy. High quality local produce and large breakfast selection. cons: some areas around the indoor pool looking a bit mouldy. the indoor pool was cold and the jets were not really powerful to make it Spa like. There could be a wider menu including salads and vegetarian food.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Nice big and very quiet room. Amazing breakfast and a very pretty setting. cons: 25- Euros charge for a small dog is pretty high.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Facilities and staff were excellent-lovely relaxed pace in the hotel - nothing was a problem - staff were exceptional cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: It was fine but not replenished when things ran out cons: Replenishing of breakfast

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Superb beds very stylish hotel cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Best choice I have made for years to stay at this hotel cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This is a most comfortable hotel and has a great mix of rococo architecture and modern enormous bedrooms each with a really private terrace. The staff are very well trained friendly and accommodating. The views are magnificent down to the coast around Faro and dinner on the dining terrace at sunset is a great experience. The pool is enormous and extremely clean. The gardens are fun too with recent and ancient planting and statuary. Parking outside or underground (lift) was safe and easy. cons: The kitchen sometimes seemed overstretched meaning a few waits or items not on menu but on the whole the food was good. ( Breakfast buffet was an exceptional range of fresh fruits cheeses breads hams etc alongside a fully  cooked option. Good coffee.)

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: this is a former palace that has been converted to hotel and has great position and facilities cons: cats and smoking allowed on dining terraces

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The building and the size of the hotel room cons: the pool was too cold and some of the staff in the restaurant were not trained well.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent hotel with a rich history. Fantastic sunset views. Friendly staff at reception cons: No coffee/ tea making facility in the room.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The breakfast was very good and the pool excellent.
The old town is lovely and the Cathedral well worth a visit. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything cons: We’d have like the pool to have been open a little bit later but all perfect other than that!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: everything was super nice
the rooms are magnificent and the whole place also. staff are very nice and helpful cons: the y charged 2 euros for a small glass of water. we tried to understand but they said: these are the rules. which for me it’s crazy

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Everything good  staff politeinformativehelpful. cons: Perhaps more evening meal dishes in restaurant.
What was provided was good more meal options even better .   Head of kitchen was very approachable and a likeable person.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Room was very spacious and comfortable the bed was huge and bathroom had plenty of towels and lovely toiletries although the room was very long walk back to the main part of the hotel so don't forget anything (Room 20). 
Breakfast was superb so much available and all very fresh. 
Pool was well kept clean and tidy. 
Setting is stunning. 
Bar staff very knowledgeable good with wine recommendations and descriptions. cons: Check in was a little chaotic lots of printed papers all over the desk with guests booking details.
There was no access to the main gardens via the iron gates unless you walk through town unsure why that is but a shame as night time strolls would have been nice. 
No music on the terrace so the late night atmosphere was very sombre although relaxing!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Great restaurant amazing pool area and the gardens where really nice cons: nothing not to like

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: marvelous property that has been beautifully redone. it combines modern and historical elements. The rooms are spacious. The staff is very friendly and pay great attention to customers. Very nice breakfast! There’s a bar at the pool offering hot and cold beverages ice cream and even burgers and soups. we used the hotel as a base for visiting Algarve but you can easily spend a few days here. cons: we stayed 5 nights and on our first evening we found garbage on the property and told the reception about it. When we left the garbage was still there. For a 5star hotel this should not be tolerated. In the parking garage there was one garbage bin that was already full when we arrived and it wasn’t emptied until we left (the other was though).

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything it was so peaceful the staff comfort…. cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful Building combining a glorious old palace with a modern hotel cons: Power sockets werent close to bed side table or easy to access

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: It was Super to stay there. 
It lived up to all expectations and has a very interesting history. Would recommend. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Amazing building in gorgeous quiet village. Great design in new bedroom wing with especially good bed linens on very large bed in great room. cons: As noted elsewhere no sockets beside bed. Dinner was uneven but not awful as suggested in other reviews.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Wow just wow a magnificent building with such history beautiful gardens & setting with a modern hotel with great facilities collocated. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Very helpful polite and friendly staff beautiful room great facilities as of course incredibly beautiful and structured hotel cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: We absolutely loved this hotel it was just breathtaking and a real gem. The room was very clean and very comfortable and a large size. The breakfast was incredible with lots of options. The grounds of the hotel and the original parts of the palace are beautifully renovated and maintained. We were always able to get a lounger by the pool. We took a taxi to Faro for a day trip which was about 15 euros each way. cons: We hadn't arranged a reservation with the restaurant for dinner in advance and were unable to get a table on a weekday night. We were offered a seat at the bar and the staff were as accommodating as possible but we ended up eating elsewhere.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Fabulous breakfast 
Fantastic pool
Beautiful historic building cons: We had dinner one night which was disappointing. However when we spoke to the manager we were not charged for this and we received a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The breakfast was superb  evening meals were also delicious. The village is a little small not much to do. You certainly need a car. cons: The evening menu could be changed more often.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Very good breakfast excellent choices cons: Dinner choices not available on our two nights. Change of menu or dish of the day would have been welcome for variety

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Our room was spacious and really nice cons: When you look at the rear of the hotel you can see the highway and when outside sometimes you hear the noise of the train. But inside of the hotel it’s really calm and you hear nothing from the outside.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: good rooms clean and comfortable cons: it is not 5 stars hotel  restaurant menu is poor but staff is doing as much as they can. Probably Top management of the hotel has to be replaced to force again the glory of such place.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: We enjoyed stay in the hotel beautiful view from the terrace while having delicious buffet breakfast with home made jams and sweets. Clean spacious room helpful staff we had dinner there too and was very good especially local Cataplana  dish. Hotel is located in small village about 15 min from Faro you can get there by bus during week days or taxi. 
There is small local restaurant in Estoi where you should try grilled fish. Walking distance are Roman ruins. cons: Gardens will need more care as they look more abandon.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: beautiful rooms. loved the room layout and sizes. kept very clean. wish could have stayed longer than the two days. cons: some of the bathroom fittings need attending to as they are falling off

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: nice size room pool had a great view. cons: the checkin wasn't the best

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Exceptional breakfast with many options and local products.
Big sized room and bed with nice terrace.
Beautiful pool and lounge area. 
Staff is very friendly and professional they did a great job and always accommodated all our requests. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: A unique location!!!! A great mix between tradition (the manor) and modern comfort (rooms which are big and clean are in a newly built part).
Outstanding breakfast in a great sourrounding. The dinner at the restaurant was also very tasty.
Staff was very friendly and helpful. cons: Not negative but this place has a lot of additional potential. Some of the historic parts are not used (yet). One should bring them back to life.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The free breakfast was absolutely amazing. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The bedroom was amazing.  The bed was huge.  The pool area is nice - a bit small but good for this boutique-sized hotel. cons: The hotel restauring had poor food reviews and the menu was very unusual so we didn't eat there.  This was a shame as I feel it's a missed opportunity for the hotel as there's not many places in which to eat in Estoi.

The hotel was booked out for a private party on the day we were departing and we were unable to use the pool after midday.  We didn't discover this until after breakfast that day when we were going out for a walk when we noticed a sign at the pool entrance.  I feel we should have been informed of this the previous evening so we could have had an early morning swim - as it turned out we couldn't use the pool at all that day.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: superb location cons: Had lunch on arrival and offered same menu for dinner. Poor choice although we had a great duck confit on the second Night. very limited bar food menu. Very good breakfast selection.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful decor in Hotel and museum very interesting.
A very unique place .
Nice large room in a purpose built modern accommodation block with air con . cons: Lunch time menu same as evening menu and quite limiting choices .
Had a coffee cup given with large lipstick stain so lacked attention to detail I would expect from this quality of hotel .

Small  reception area with only one staff member so quite a wait to check in (15 minutes )

Have  been here before and felt formal gardens needed attention to keep really crisp and neat .

Did not put TV on so did not realise needed to book restaurant but Maitre D. very kindly accommodated us she was most helpful .

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Mostly everything. A wonderful concept mixing a highly modern hotel with a well preserved villa full of character rich in history so close to a Roman archaeological site. Loved that we could leave our luggage at the reception and walk around even if we arrived before the designated  check-in time. Most of the staff are super kind and friendly. cons: One gentleman taking care of us for dinner seemed a bit neglectful. We were never asked if we wanted another drink or any desert after the main course. Seemed like we were given less attention than any other table around us.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast excellent. Lots of variety. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The rooms the swimming pool and the  setting. cons: That rooms were not cleaned until the evening.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: gorgeous venue with spectacular views cons: absolutely nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful building with well planned extensions. Meals on the terrace were extremely enjoyable. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The meals were as delicious as the pool and vice versa. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: stunning architecture cons: coffee was very bad

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Everything. It was amazing cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful palace and grounds which have been converted into a hotel.  Rooms are very large (even the standard) and well-appointed in a minimalist decor.  The pool area is great as was breakfast.  Well worth the short walk through town to walk through the lower gardens (not accessible from the hotel directly). cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful building with modern bedroom annex gorgeous pool area & classical gardens. Wonderful staff free upgrade because I had stayed before but all of the rooms are nice. Estoi is a lovely authenic Portugese village with Roman ruins just a short walk from the hotel cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: pool and surrounds and restaurant cons: lack of staff

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: a stunning hotel in a quaint and quiet village! perfect for a quick get away… less than 15 minutes from the airport.
faultless staff environment and dining! cons: nothing!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Access to the Palace rooms.  Breakfast on the terrace was fabulous. cons: Service was a little haphazard  and slow at times.  The hotel could make a lot more if they had more staff taking orders e.g. by the pool and at the bar.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Building Breakfast and the location cons: Matress less than comfortable. Carpet in Room was heavily stained. Rooms felt tired.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The hotel is great staff was very nice and helpful especially Ines from Spa had a great massage breakfast was nice as well. cons: Restaurant I ordered one meal and in the dessert there were egg shells.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: absolutely beautifully renovated palace with modern accomodation cons: nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful hotel and grounds so unique! cons: There’s not lots open in Estoi on the off season however you’re only 20 minutes in a taxi in to the heart of Faro!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: BEAUTIFUL scenery and place. cons: Early closure of pools... especially indoor pool

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Amazing place. Large rooms. Comfortable bed. high pressure shower. Great building lobby gardens swimming pool. cons: Breakfast had awful coffee from powder like in the automatic machines you have in hospitals and train stations. The orange juice was not fresh and sweetened. We couldn’t get any fresh juice which is odd when it comes to a 5 stars hotel.

The gym was hot and there was no AC. There were no towels and no water. We asked for water which never arrived.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Breakfast and the rooms cons: The inner pool was very small and the gardens around the hotel should be available to visit.
Hotel personnel were caught discussing between them several times (something to do with work load distribution...).
Check-in and check-out should be improved (a "donation" rate was added to the bill and only after was explained what it was meant to...)

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The hotel in itself is a museum with modern hotel facilities very nice indeed. cons: the food service very slow.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The heritage and history. Spacious room and bathroom. Serene and peaceful garden. cons: They didn’t noticed it was my birthday the day we checked in.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: unique and beautiful hotel main highlight of Estoi. modern and renovated rooms. great view all the way to the sea. cons: the hotel was not able to provide room service. they didn’t warn us in advance that the restaurant is fully booked and room service will be difficult because it’s weekend and busy. also not many restaurants around to choose. we expected from such a hotel to plan better their peak especially if it’s every weekend.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: it is a gorgeous property. the home is historic but the rooms are very comfortable with a modern feel. the breakfast was so delicious. We also ate dinner at the hotel and it was our best meal in Portugal. The pool was lovely and walking the grounds was so relaxing. cons: There was not a thing we would change. Infact the receptionist asked ask if there were any improvements we would recommend and we told her it was the best hotel of our vacation.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Excellent breakfast sweet staff and wonderful place with long vistas and tranquil ambience. cons: Beds could be softer! This seems to be a Southern European thing..

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful hotel superb accommodations!
Peaceful and charming stay. cons: Poor lighting at bathroom.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Staff. cons: Design of bathrooms menu somewhat limited for a two week stay.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The staff here was lovely went above and beyond to make sure we had a pleasant stay. The hotel itself is beautiful with the perfect blend of preserving the old beauty of the building and modernising the facilities. cons: The area of Estoi itself is quiet and nice with easy accessibility to the larger city of Faro. Just know that outside of the hotel facilities there are very few other things to do/places to eat within walking distance of the hotel.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Amazing hotel and really nice breakfast.
Really nice employees.
Overall very nice! cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Hotel in a small village with great views. 
Spacious and beautiful interiors . Staff excellent 
Spa treatment was fantastic cons: Restaurant . Room a little soulless.  Other lounges were superb. Menu Limited and more homely cooking

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Rooms were extremely generous and comfortable. Setting was quirky. Breakfast was generous and of good quality. cons: Quite an unwelcome and slow check-in as staff member scrutinised our Covid documentation and told us that we would have to go to breakfast before 9.00 am the next morning as our 48 hours post-testing ran out. Suspect this was not right but went along with a strong sense of general gate-keeping!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Unique experience cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: This hotel is superb!!! Both breakfast and dinner were great. Thanks for the hospitallity that we received from the team. And from Victoria the floormanager  of the restaurant. Thank you very much!! cons: Nothing.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautifully restored period building sympathetically and cleverly integrated with modern architecture providing excellent accommodation with old world charm. cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Away from the bustle this is a little renovated palace with spacious modern rooms attached to them overlooking the renovated gardens. Breakfast was good and substantial and the dinner we had was very good as well. cons: Small issue but which is a nuisance. No phone plugs or chargers by the bed. The plugs are on the walls.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Amazing Palace and Grounds the new and the old blend well together offering history with all modern conveniences. the staff were excellent. lovely location and the terraces offer great views and privacy. cons: it still says on the official website (just rechecked) that the gym and indoor pool are closed so we did not bring any clothing for either. we were tod they were open on arrival so this needs to be clarified on the website

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The room and bathroom were spacious. Great terrace and location is great close to Faro. Nice view of Faro and surrounding area. Breakfast buffet was great a lot of sweet and savory options (though no meat options outside pork). Lovely and helpful staff. cons: Still enjoyable but outdated spa area needs refurbishment. The outdoor pool isn't heated so the water is freezing cold such a pity. The Christmas eve menu was slightly overpriced (90€ per person wine included) but I appreciated the gesture to reduce the bill since I don't drink alcohol. It would be great to have some milk with the English breakfast tea bags. Kettle is available but on demand. No iron in the room. Bedside sockets are under the table so you literally need to crawl to plug something.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The breakfast was great but wish there was a toaster. The exterior gardens and palace and interior palace rooms and reception are beautiful and historic cons: One of the towels had a stain could have just been clean and an old stain. The interior was quite dated and the rug has visible stains as well.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful hotel garden and surroundings. Quiet. Great view from balcony. cons: Beds uncomfortable like sleeping on a bench. 
Dinner and breakfast disappointing. Tasteless and boring.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Interesting building. Good pools. Large rooms. Great Breakfast. cons: Tired needs a revamp especially carpets and gardens

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The hotel is well located cons: It is very tired in places lack of attention to detail in many areas. We stayed 2 nights and the same discarded water bottles were left on the floor of the terrace the same tables not wiped down. Getting the attention of staff for a coffee during breakfast was painful. 
I requested an extra bed and my messages ignored twice so I drove the hour from my home the week before my stay to ensure we would have this and still when we arrived we were told no request had been received. 
The staff did not seem to be very helpful in general I got married on the Saturday during my stay and returned after the ceremony in full wedding dress and staff did not even bother to say congratulations or hold the door open (we had our arms full). Little things like this really let the hotel down. I found the bed’s uncomfortable and the room very cold so had to get blankets from the wardrobe (I don’t know how clean they were I would have thought a hotel with 5 stars would have duvets?). The garden outside our terrace was very unkept and a little overgrown . Water was not replenished on the second night but it was for other guests staying at the hotel so lack of consistency there

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The history and the reuse of what was a derelict site. Breakfast was good but we didn’t use the restaurant other than that. cons: Some staff did not seem happy to be working there. Litter in the grounds sen on arrival was still there when we left three days later. The grounds/gardens are a feature of the property and desperately need maintenance.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Layout was nice cons: Staff rude and overcharging on the drinks food wasn't great..the prawns still had the black part not removed wouldn't expect to see this in a 5 star
Beds rock hard uncomfortable

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: A historical property with friendly staff. The facilities are ok but the property is in need of an overhaul. cons: The hotel is quite tired. I’m surprised it is a Small Luxury Hotel of the World. I would rate it as a 3-4 star.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The palace areas were beautiful and the pool had a lovely view cons: None of the rooms are in the palace they are in a modern annex which seems to clash with the entire palace vibe. The palace itself was a little run down as was the surrounding area. There was no conditioner in the bathrooms poor quality hair dryer and they do not provide ironing boards to the room.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The actual main building (palace) is beautiful but the rooms building is too modern and does not.match the Palace cons: Restaurant manager was rude and stressed and place was full of cats

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was good except for the coffee served with I believe was condensed milk or sweetened milk. Service in the restaurant was very slow and you had to eat with 5 cats staring at you wanting handouts cons: Hallway had extremely strong fragrance which was irritating to the eyes and you could not open the door to the patio due to very strong sewer smell

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Location
Beds were comfy
Food tasty cons: Service was really slow
It looked a little tired and unkempt

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Lovely bar and lounge area cons: Outside grounds need better up keep 2 dead cockroaches found outside bedroom door service in restaurant was poor very long waits uncooked potatoes could hear other tables complaining too.
Toilets off bar and lounge area very poor asthetically

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The place looks amazing but we have no time to see the whole territory cons: It was the worst experience ever. We came to spend two days in a small luxury hotel peaceful and beautiful. But we were faced with rude staff in the bar. We were with a small dog and asked ahead about the possibility to take him to the bar (only on the terrace) in a special carriage. But the first question (or statement?) was: dogs are not allowed on the terrace. Aren't they?  We were confused and after 2 hours in the car without lunch we had to settle this issue once again with management and once again we received a positive answer. Then nobody could tell us where we can order the lunch from the menu on website and finally we were waiting about an hour for  chiken wrap sandwich (16 euro) that finally was so strange like it was made by the waiter in a hurry and we were not sure it has been made of chicken not pork. So we had to literally escape from this paradise because nobody can tell us what's going on. It seemed there were no managers in the hotel. Low season and unprofessional staff. This hotel spoiled our vacation. Also I'd like to mention that rooms are shabby and you should be ready that during the day they have groups of tourists in the hotel because it's a museum....

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The surroundings cons: Limited menu limited bar snacks. Not much atmosphere. Very poor takeaway breakfast

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was very good but some of the restaurant staff seemed a bit unfriendly. The hotel is very nice and the two parlor rooms near the restaurants are beautiful. The front desk associates were extremely polite and helpful. cons: The bedroom contained twin beds although we requested a double/full bed. It's difficult to comprehend why they have twin beds in the first place because the room was not small. The room was cold and not very inviting or even comfortable. Our balcony door opened up on to a porch and rooftop garden that you couldn't walk out onto because everything was so overgrown and unkept. Definitely Not worth the extra cost.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful palace common rooms excellent breakfast and pleasant garden. cons: Basically it is a normal basic hotel connected to a  monument rooms have the modern decoration with no “luxury charm” claimed one can only find it in the common rooms in the palace. Spa is  tiny with no standing staff (one needs to call the reception but guess where the phone is and what number to use).
Apart from the breakfast service is slow with gaps (at bar wrap with avocato had none with no notice…).

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Very spacious room and bathroom excellent breakfast. cons: Indeed it was once a palace. But today it looks neglected and quite faded and does not deserve to be called "Palacio".

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Palace is very impressive nice architecture & design cons: Staff was not friendly or willing to work except for reception. Few English skills no service at the pool or terrace (self service even though there was plenty of personnel!) used glasses were not removed staff at the bar did not communicate well and was sometimes even rude

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: View size of rooms… cons: Catering food service

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast is great cons: Cleanliness and upkeep of facilities is not great

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros:  cons: Far from ‘A small luxury hotel of the World’. No porter service and only one receptionist. So a long wait.
Very unattractive hotel building with endless corridors next to the Palacio. Pool area is ok but for the rest we felt fooled. Pictures are misleading.Staff is unfriendly and uncooperative. Food is mediocre and rooms are without atmosphere and without any view. An expensive(!) no go place.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Big room very comfortable caring staff cons: Noise at night

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The pool was lovely and the rooms were really spacious and clean. Air conditioning was great also cons: The food was pretty bad very overpriced and quality terrible. Everything was clearly microwaved and tasted like it. We also ordered the vegetarian pasta from the main menu and literally received five pieces of ravioli. After complaining they did offer a substitute but we declined however still charged full price for the meal. The lamb was clearly microwaved and overpriced and tasted off. For the price you would expect more. Also the first two days there was a wedding the place was completely overrun and couldn’t order a drink at the bar. Staff could smile a bit more and you had to basically beg for coffee in the morning. Did send message to complain via booking but did not receive a response the spa/gym is not a spa/gym either.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Jorge in the bar - restaurant was fantastic I found most of the other staff lacking personality and most of the time no one was around for help & advice cons: How long drinks food took to arrive - unless Jorge was around nothing got done in a quick attentive manor

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Nice pool nice hotel. cons: Advertised as per friendly it’s not. Your pet basically is confined to your room.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was very good.  Lunch menu was exactly the same as evening menu unless you ate off the swimming pool snack menu which was very expensive.  We did try 2 x chicken wraps from this menu at 14 euro each and I complained that there was virtually no chicken it just the top you could see so 28 euro for 2 lettuce wraps is excessive.  The waitress said she would tell the chef but we got no response.  In regard to the evening menu which we tried at least 3 times this was very mixed sometimes good and reasonable value for a cheese platter (18 euro for sharing) cod loin and tagliatelle also good but slightly expensive.  The other problem item was 6 pieces of ravioli for 17 euro albiet they may have been freshly made but lacked flavour and at that price were nothing like a meal. The other item to mention which is also confusing is the lack of tea/coffee making facility in a luxury hotel and when I mentioned this to receptiion they said they don't do it.  I had a short email survey the following day mentioned the lack of a kettle etc and low and behold said items appeared!  If this survey does reach the management I would very much like to be refunded for the Chicken Wraps as I feel that I was deceived with the way they were presented and never received an apology. cons: See above

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was alright but very bad service. Wild cats on the property while having breakfast climbing on our table. cons: Staff terrible and rude. Bad room ants on patio that was falsely advertised balcony to be fair I am disappointed at Booking.com for rating it a five star hotel because it is not a five star hotel more like a one star.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: N/A cons: Facilities faulty/ not maintained/ not clean throughout spa isn't functioning 
Staff not professional or attentive
Service not 5star/luxury level- multiple messed up orders
Unsafe facilities- lift certificate out of date broken bread knife place out for customers to use broken fixtures in bathroom 
Hotel isn't as described in the advert and isn't worth the money

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The palacio and the facilities cons: on the whole the service SUCKS. shortage of staff and they were unprofessional apart from a few. Most of them didn’t know what they were doing. looks like they came directly from the street without any experience. 
we couldn’t get beers for 2 days only non alcoholic drinks and cocktails were available. This is very bad for a supposingly 5 star hotel.
Bad management on the whole. In the restaurant for dinner we had to wait for 1/2 hour before someone took our orders and it took a very long time before our food arrived. 
we had dinner 2 nights in a row and it was the same. 
on the whole I should say that the Pousada is badly managed. it is pity really since the palacio is such a fantastic place. 
There was a large group of Americans there too and there is no excuse at all for the bad service. They hotel must have known this a long way ahead and yet????
we have stay at this Pousada I think this was our third time and this was the worst experience we had so far.
No proper bar tender. who ever who was working at the bar couldn’t even make or serve a simple Martini as it should be . shame shame!!!!
For breakfast it was the same thing. the serving plates on the buffet table were mostly empty most of the time. 
inexperience staff. we pay for service when we stay at such an establishment and we expect it as well.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The pool cons: The bar staff service

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The hotel offers good value for the price which includes a fabulous buffet breakfast. The staff were attentive and friendly. The views are incredible and the ancient grounds and walled garden are lovely to explore. cons: I did not appreciate that Booking.com promotes it as a 5-star hotel. It may have been exceptional 30 years ago when the new addition was added but since then it has deteriorated significantly and needs updating and repair.  Tired and stained carpets and overall cleanliness are not up to snuff. It is also important to understand that the bedrooms are not in the 17th-century palace but in a 30-year-old modern annex down the side. The web site is misleading.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Nice place historical. Pets friendly cons: Dark souterrain where the normal rooms are

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The room was a good size very clean with nice open view and the hotel is very spacious with interesting historical grounds near the centre of Estoi. cons: The description of hotel restaurant as “Algarvean Gourmet” is misleading. It is just a cynical ruse to minimise kitchen costs whilst charging  pie-in-the-sky high prices. An average dinner starter + main + dessert will cost a couple around the price of the room (130 Euros) The fancy menu is carefully contrived to minimise the chef’s preparation time of the meagre portions they serve. If you are hungry for a proper dinner there are no alternative restaurants in Estoi to provide any competition.  The advice is ‘check out online UberEats in the Faro area before you make your reservation’. There are excellent alternative restaurants nearby who will deliver a substantial Algarvean prata do dia to your hotel room at a sensible price.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful historical palace oozing character and elegance. Funky modern rooms which provide a striking contrast. Great views from the rooms - spacious room layout. cons: Hotel greatly under staffed. Barman doing bar service room service and bar snacks. Tables left uncleared in all public areas. Bins over filling in public toilets hallways and reception area. Stale breakfast box provided in lieu of breakfast - number of guests asking why breakfast service does not start before 8am
On check-in being escorted to the room  ambience ruined by 3 cleaning trolleys and vacuums being left outside our room still at 4pm. 
Snack menu only consisted of 1 item  toasted sandwich - needs a better selection. 
Barman apologised he did not have suffifient glassware to serve drinks in correct glasses. 
No tea or coffee maker in room.  
Only 2 electric sockets in the bedroom.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros:  cons: The breakfast was poor and so was the service and food in the restaurant during dinner . The house keepers kept on forgetting to replenish toiletries and every day’s replenishment could be different .

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The property exterior is beautiful. cons: Poor quality rooms staff training and dinner menu

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The location and the overall feel of the hotel is great along with the breakfast and the pool. cons: I booked a king-size bed and got a twin bed instead (2 shoved together) which I really hate.   You fall down the gap as a single (and no doubt as a couple).   

The hotel seems understaffed for a "5-star" property.   I had heavy bags and no one offered help or helped get the bags to my room - which was a long long way from reception.     

I called to change room but no one answered as soon as I saw it was a twin room - so finally had to walk back to reception to try to change it as no one was answering after 5-10 minutes.     Reception said there was only 1 room left and it was another twin.   (There appeared to be more than 7 rooms showing as available on Booking.com).      I was going to move hotels as I hate twin beds - but it was getting late etc.  

The restaurant was to close at 10:30 pm - so I got there at 9:45 pm and was greeted by the host with a bit of attitude/lack of enthusiasm.   Very much felt it was an inconvenience for them.   Again not great for a "5-star" property.    But the dinner was nice so all good in the end.   

Another couple I met at the restaurant that checked in just before me got a king-size bed- and had somehow double booked so their second room so explained that should be available as well.   I went to check with reception and again no other rooms were available.    It just seemed strange that 7 rooms were showing as available but reception said only 1 and that was a twin.      Maybe that was the case so all good.

The room and hotel overall - just a little tired in places - bath wouldn't drain properly.  Grim around the toilet flush button.  Pool spa wouldn't work.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Great little oasis
Lovely garden and great pool. 
Beds comfortable and good shower cons: This has the small luxury hotel badge and having stayed at others this does not quite meet the standards. The breakfast was not good. Eggs were just very milky fluff and Algarve being where oranges literally come from - the juices were not fresh / natural. at the very least you expect natural orange juice from the region that grows oranges! 
The door closest to cars was locked which means you have to lug your wheelie luggage through an entrance that has couple of steps which is inefficient. For an SLH hotel quite a few improvements are required. the bathroom although very powerful are a bit dated. The sheets were cold no extra blanket. 
You are obliged to have your clothes pressed at a price because irons are not allowed (apparently illegal due to fire risk) 
The staff were very friendly and always super helpful so could not fault the service experience from Reception to Restaurant and cleaning staff - all lovely and helpful team. 
However the facilities really need a revamp. Therefore the value for money was completely unjustified

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: It’s a beautiful building - the palace is amazing and the rooms annexe is very nicely done. The pool area is nice albeit a bit small perhaps. cons: It needs some TLC. ripped towels. Filthy curtains with holes. The gardens were severely overgrown. Only two of the staff ever smiled - everyone seemed miserable. Getting a taxi was always a pain. It just wasn’t anything we had hoped.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: the palace is beautiful. however its open to everyone so no need to stay in the hotel for this.
Eusebio the receptionist is super friendly and stands out. cons: everything is a bit dark used (holes in the curtains stains on the carpets) not cleaned well (hairs in the bathroom clogged shower—both from the first day on no attention to details personal is max average. the clogged shower however was fixed the day after we mentioned it to Eusebio.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Staff lovely. Hotel is pretty on the whole. Nice experience for a stopover. Pool was gorgeous and sauna area nice too. cons: Two main things: beds and food. Worst beds ever! So unbelievably uncomfortable. Food was expensive and terrible. We dined one night in the restaurant and it was awful even though the staff were lovely. Estoi is also a ghost town so no options for good food there either. Fine for one night stay but no more than that.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was excellent cons: Nothing

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The breakfast offered good  fresh options and had a wide variety of options.  The dining room and terrace were good spaces for having breakfast.
On the terrace the bushes that face the terrace coulfpd use a trimming as it obstructed the wonderful view.
The staff were very polite but could use more training to offer help and dining services to bring things up to world class status.
We know that staffing is difficult in Portugal but quality of service should be strived for to have guests return. cons: Staffing and quality of service is a big one.
In the pool area knowledge of drinks and availability of items lacking.  For a world class hotel you would think that there would also be service to guests sitting about on the deck to enhance there experience.
The gardens - main and outside rooms was in need of attention as well as windows that were very dirty.  You open the curtains to see the view and get dirty windows.
We loved Estoi - the Palace and appreciate how the new addition was blended into the landscape with natural plantings on the roofs.  Great idea for entities and cooling nature for the buildings.
The lack of a concierge was a problem in that we needed to ask for options for dining and other tourist info and it was not available.
To truly rate yourself as a world class hotel we feel that these items should be addressed.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Breakfast was good.  Went down to dinner on my own.  More staff than clients and was told I needed to book a table.  Found the majority of staff to not be very friendly which was a great shame as a nice hotel but would't come back. cons: Staff could be friendlier and more approachable

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Beautiful 18th century building with fabulous gardens and views. cons: Even though I made my reservation way in advance for a special reason a couple of weeks before my arrival I was informed that the suite I requested was unavailable due to “unforeseen circumstances” and I was offered a discount to be downgraded to a standard room. Had I known the unforeseen circumstances was actually a wedding taking place at the venue on the same weekend I would have declined the offer immediately. 
Perhaps this is a great venue for weddings! As an hotel guest I felt neglected and unwelcome.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Beautiful setting hotel was beautiful. cons: Staff were very ridged not welcoming at the front desk. Had to book for dinner even though you were staying there.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros:  cons: The mandatory buffet on Saturday night was the worst meal I had in 2 weeks in Portugal – and cost 40 Euros.  All appetizers were served cold – including pastel of baccalau - and appeared to be the kind that one could find at any grocery store.  There were 3 main courses in steam dishes but none of the food was better than a bit more than lukewarm.  None were hot.  The first was all vegetables – broccoli so old that it had turned yellow on the tips before cooking - and  all were overcooked.  The second was mostly overcooked vegetables with some octopus.  Third was pork cubes with some potatoes with absolutely no distinguishing taste.  Dessert was no better than I would expect to get in a second rate bakery in the US.
I strongly suggest that anypne staying here on a Saturday night skip the buffet and eat at any one of several restaurants in Estoi.

The common areas are lovely.  The room is fine except that the only electric plugs are one inconveniently located under the desk where it an only be reached on hands and knees and the second more than 2 meters from the bed at floor level.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The main building with its small garden. Bartender. 
Good garage. cons: The beds are rock hard.
We lived on floor 0 felt like living underground.
The garden in front of the room's terrace poorly maintained garden area. Well-being would be significantly increased if a view was created from the room's terrace.
The roads to the hotel are extremely small and it is almost impossible to get there with a larger car.
The first thing you see when you enter the reception. is a garbage station to the hotel (with gates that could be closed so you could not see it but they were open both when we came and went)

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: the palace and gardens breakfast is good cons: rooms very basic and do not reflect the property. staff and service very slow. no tea or coffee in the room.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: The architecture is stunning and location amazing. Staff very friendly especially on reception. cons: These comments are made with constructive criticism in mind - we are not angry but just felt the hotel could do so so much better for some little effort and some attention to detail. We were disappointed that the same menu all week and food not quite top notch. No special options each day. No different lunch menu offered - tapas or bruschetta or local delicacies would be nice but just the lacklustre evening menu repeated. Poolside bar not open at all and nobody on tap asking if we would like a drink. A completely non-functional bar area with absolutely nowhere to site and nobody manning it (use one of the amazing rooms why not?). Detritus not removed around pool all day. Wardrobe doors in rooms slam so noisily. Blocked off routes and locked gates around property not allowing you to have a really nice wander around. Rooms not made up at all when we put signs on doors for speedy service.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Nice view from the terrace. cons: Sauna was not hot service in restaurant was poor and food was no near a 5 star luxury hotel of the world - we advised our requests of vegan before our arrival and no attention was given ( we were given butter and Parmesan cheese ) limited staff on arrival and throughout the hotel no engagement from them to ensure the guest is looked after blocked public toilets and no soap rooms are dated. Don't waste your money.. we were on a 6 night road trip from Lisbon and this was the worse accommodation and for nearly 200 euros a night- completely disappointed

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: The outdoor and indoor areas of the hotel are as gorgeous as depicted in the photos offering a cozy and luxurious atmosphere. The room and en-suite bathroom were spacious. cons: The hotel staff was mixed bag of highly professional to very amateurish personnel. Particularly bar and restaurant staff did not fulfil what you would be expected from a Pestana hotel. 

Like others have noted the restaurant and breakfast buffet are a big disappointment. The service took forever and the meat at dinner was inedible.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World

reviewText:

was dirty and the room service menu was appallingly bad. I was offered a plastic glass for the cocktail I ordered which I found unacceptable. 

All things I expect to be far better from a luxury hotel.

reviewText:
pros: Desayuno fantástico.
La experiencia de estar en un lugar antiguo precioso pero con todas las comodidades de un hotel nuevo.
El personal muy amable y resolutivo.
Buen tamaño de la habitación estaba muy bien insonorizada cons: La cuna del bebé estaba un poco usada.
La terraza de las habitaciones se podría aprovechar mejor mejores muebles más cómodos.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Precioso palacio y jardines. Habitaciones modernas. Camas amplias y muy cómodas. Personal muy amable. Museo de piezas arqueológicas y galería de arte moderna. Se accede por la antigua capilla. Tres salones impresionantes y terraza con excelentes vistas. cons: Algunas zonas necesitan un mejor mantenimiento. Faltaban enchufes en lugares accesibles. No pudimos relajarnos el viernes por la mañana en la terraza y piscina ya que estaban con el cortador de setos sin parar. No conseguimos que funcionase el cargador eléctrico para el coche. La piscina del Spa era demasiado básica.

reviewText: pros: Piscina spa pequeno-almoço soberbo e funcionários super simpáticos e prestáveis. Faz toda a diferença estar num alojamento onde o tratamento aos hóspedes é de excelência. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Gostámos de tudo é uma excelente unidade hoteleira espectacular localização excelente atendimento atenciosos e sempre atentos muito obrigado. Unidade a recomendar certamente. cons: O cartão de boas vindas que encontrámos no quarto estava erradamente endossado a um "Estimado João" quando a reserva foi efectuada em nome de Maria João de Figueiredo alertada a funcionária da recepção para tal em jeito construtivo o cartão permaneceu o mesmo teria sido bom que tivesse tomado a iniciativa de o alterar.
Ficámos com a sensação de que o jardim ao lado da sala de refeições lado leste em se encontra ladeado por colunas se encontrava pouco cuidado se bem que o tempo não tem ajudado contudo podia estar melhor face ao principal.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: O local onde se encontra o palácio remete-nos para um ambiente onde reina a tranquilidade os cheiros do campo 
e os sons envolventes da natureza. Vivemos uma experiência única que nos remete a uma viagem no tempo pudemos apreciar os belos jardins do palácio a arquitetura do seu interior apreciar arte moderna em contraste com a história do hotel. Os quartos são amplos e confortáveis e o pequeno almoço é excelente com variedade e qualidade. O serviço é muito bom todo o staff demonstra simpatia e espontaneidade além se serem muito prestáveis. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:

Muy recomendable. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: El palacio de Estoi es maravilloso. Los salones increíbles y bien decorados. Los jardines muy bien cuidados ofreciendo un entorno increíble. El desayuno inmejorable y muy variado.
En cuanto a las habitaciones estaban en un ala anexa al palacio y contaban con un baño muy amplio camas muy cómodas y un balcón con mesa.
El único inconveniente es la distancia con los puntos mas famosos del Algarve como Lagos y Albufeira pero si cuentas con auto esto no supone un problema cons:

reviewText: pros: Edifício muito bonito assim como os espaços envolventes. Instalações modernas quarto espaçoso bem insonorizado e climatizado. Oferta de boas-vindas: prato de frutas e mensagem personalizada. cons: Distância entre acessos (recepção elevador) e quartos. Dava jeito um meio de transporte para carregar as bagagens de pessoas com mais dificuldade de locomoção como era o caso. Um dos candeeiros do quarto não funcionava. Pequeno-almoço no terraço com muitas vespas à volta dos pratos. Absurdo ter que pagar por uma garrafa de água mineral tendo em conta o preço da estadia!

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Boa combinação entre edifício antigo e arquitetura moderna dos quartos.
Local tranquilo e bonito (envolvente rural).
Bom pequeno-almoço. cons: Os jardins não estavam tão cuidados como deveriam sobretudo a poda dos arbustos.
O espaço da piscina interior e do ginásio é pequeno (o ginásio é uma sala com 3 aparelhos e um deles não estava a funcionar).
É um bom hotel mas com preço algo exagerado para o que oferece.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: El desayuno bastante completo pero si que se noto diferencia de semana a fin de semana en la cantidad de productos ya que había mas huéspedes las piscinas no son muy grandes pero cumplen totalmente ubicación bastante buena para moverte a otros pueblos y en Estoi a pesar de ser un pueblo pequeño tenias todos los servicios esenciales como súper farmacia… cons: Que había demasiados gatos por los jardines y no podías abrir la ventana ya que entraban a las habitaciones y ni siquiera sentarte en la terraza y los precios de la carta del bar de la piscina nos parecieron excesivos para la calidad y cantidad que ofrecen.

reviewText: pros: Lo que mas me gusto fue la rapidez y eficacia ante un problema con el aire acondicionado de la habitación. Rápidamente nos cambiaron de habitación sin poner pegas algunas. El personal del la posada fenomenal desde los recepcionistas camareros limpiadoras....todo el personal. Posada preciosa con unos salones maravillosos con la época de la posada. Bem climatizado. Com roupão e chinelos. Staff muito eficiente e todos muito simpáticos. Pequeno almoço excepcional na qualidade e diversidade e na apresentação. Jantar também óptimo. cons: De nada

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Palácio recuperado e ampliado com extremo bom gosto (e assinatura do arquiteto Gonçalo Byrne). As salas  antigas proporcionam uma experiência que nos remete para o passado palaciano e luxuoso e convivem em plena harmonia com todas as comodidades e modernidade da ala dos quartos. Quarto muito amplo camas grandes e muito confortáveis. Terraço do quarto muito agradável. Pequeno almoço rico com produtos frescos e variados. Pessoal maioritariamente atencioso e eficiente. Facilidade de estacionamento no exterior (embora havendo parque coberto não necessitamos usar). Jardim cuidado e esplanada do restaurante muito agradável para tomar o pequeno-almoço uma bebida. Experiência global excecional e diferente do Algarve de massas e incaracterístico. cons: A parte mais interessante (e maior) do Jardim é pertença da Câmara Municipal e o acesso faz-se por uma ruela mal assinalada no centro da vila e de muito difícil acesso que torna quase impossível a visita com idosos ou pessoas de mobilidade reduzida (mas tal não é de responsabilidade da Pousada mas antes da autarquia)
O jantar servido no restaurante é bom mas não excecional com preço demasiado elevado (€35/pessoa sem vinho)

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: La ubicación.
El Palacio y la solución dada al anexo de habitaciones modernas cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: O Palácio é lindo! Pequeno almoço excelente e os funcionários muito simpáticos e atenciosos. cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: El entorno del hotel: el palacio los jardines las salas comunes. 
La intervención arquitectónica de la parte moderna donde están las habitaciones es muy interesante. 
La habitación: enorme moderna muy bien acondicionada. Muy silencioso todo el hotel.
Esos detalles que marcan la diferencia de un hotel de esta categoría: bienvenida a tu nombre botellita de Porto dulces de bienvenida. 
Desayuno excepcional: productos de muy buena calidad y típicos regionales. 
Tiene parking subterráneo gratuito con acceso próximo a la habitación. cons: Aunque la recepción del hotel está en la antigua capilla y eso hace que la llegada sea impactante y única tal vez resulte un espacio demasiado pequeño para un hotel de 5 estrellas. Hay una única mesa y suele haber dos personas trabajando allí una de ellas con un portátil casi en una esquina de la mesa.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: Este bonito hotel está situado muy cerca del aeropuerto.
 Los enchufes de tomate corriente para cargar el móvil está muy mal situados deberian corregirlos en todas las habitaciones.  En en los hoteles actuales tienen siempre alguna toma usb.  Recomendamos se den  una vuelta los directivos por las habitaciones. Eso se hacía hace cincuenta años para no  gastar energía eléctrica.

 El personal es muy amable y quiero destacar a la señorita Anna de recepción y la señorita Veronica del comedor.  Estas dos  personas llevan una gran responsabilidad y no quiero dejar de reconocerlo

 Este año la cena de Navidad ha tenido un menú más caro que los anteriores pero no de mayor calidad 
 El plato más importante que era el faisán estaba bastante seco y no a la altura de este hotel.  Recomendamos vuelvan a poner cocina tradicional como siempre tuvieron las Pousadas cons:

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Simpatia do staff. Pequeno-almoço. Tranquilidade. Arquitetura e decoração do palácio. Cama grande e muito confortável. Paisagem e envolvência natural. Quarto espaçoso. cons: Não havia informação no booking que o posto de carregamento de veículos elétricos seria pago e em 5 anos com um veículo Tesla e a percorrer vários hotéis nacionais nunca nos tinha acontecido. Foi muito desagradável obrigou-nos a jantar no hotel (viemos de longe e o carro já ñ tinha bateria) para irmos carregar no dia seguinte perto de um Centro Comercial próximo. Tudo porque não vínhamos preparados (não tínhamos cartão de carregamento e não sabíamos que "isto" poderia acontecer). Bastava que houvesse essa informação prévia e já não teria havido tanto desconforto. No check-in informaram o casal anterior que o PA terminava às 11h mas a nós disseram que terminava às 10h30. Apesar do sorriso do staff sentirmos esse juízo de valor no nosso próprio país e num hotel de 5 estrelas é desapontante e triste.

reviewText:
pros: O edifico do Palácio e a forma com os edifícios novos e modernos estão integrados no Palácio. 
Todo o staff é de uma simpatia extrema. 
O restaurante com uma carta interessantíssima. 
Adorei ter chegado ao quarto e ter uma nota manuscrita do Hotel a desejar-me uma boa estadia. É um “pormenor” que faz a diferença. cons: Nada a apontar. Foi uma estadia perfeita.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText: pros: Es un hotel con muchísimas posibilidades pero falto de detalles.  Las habitaciones son muy grandes pero les falta calidez. Camas muy cómodas y con muy buenas sábanas. Piscina muy agradable con un minúsculo spa. Mención especial a la masajista  Inéspor su profesionalidad.  Desayuno correcto . Personal muy amable y servicial. cons: Cómo decía le faltan detalles para conseguir la excelencia que venden. El mobiliario del desayuno desentona con el palacioal menos debían de poner manteles para tapar las mesas. Descuidado igualmente el bar de la piscinael camarero era muy eficiente pero la comida deja mucho que desear. Pese a todo hemos pasado unos días estupendos . Bonito detalle a la hora de la salida interesarse por nuestra estancia y preguntarnos en que podían mejorar.

reviewText:
pros: La ubicación por las vistas y sus instalaciones. cons: Que en el aseo no hay enchufe para poder usar secador propio. 
Las habitaciones de ña planta 0 tienen una pequeña terraza pero los mosquitos no te dejan disfrutar de ella. 
Mejorar el acceso a las habitaciones 20 en adelante ya que quedan muy alejadas de las instalaciones y servicios del hotel.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: El hotel es una pasada. Está en un sitio al que hay que ir específicamente al hotel porque no tiene próximo sitios de interés. De igual forma merece la pena. Las zonas comunes son las que componen el palacio y las estancias mas "versallescas". Las habitaciones están en un edificio paralelo y son de nueva construcción. La entrada al hotel se hace a través de lo que fue la capilla.  Adicional en los jardines hay columnas romanas y dos edificios con unas cristaleras de colores que son preciosos. El personal ha sido muy agradable y todos los servicios buenos. cons: Nos dio pena que no estuvieran accesibles todas las zonas del jardín porque están en proceso de restauración. Habría sido espectacular poder ver el hotel al completo con todos los jardines. Tendremos que volver más adelante cuando esté completamente abierto al público.
Adicionalmente creo que el acceso al hotel se debería plantear por el pequeño museo y no por la capilla. Podrían aprovechar la capilla y darle algún uso. Al acceder por la capilla tienes que pasar por un estrecho pasillo lateral con las maletas y es un poco incómodo pero bueno es parte de la experiencia del hotel.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: O pequeno almoço foi excelente a variedade e qualidade dos produtos fizeram com que o dia começasse de uma maneira especial também tenho que agradecer a todo o staff do hotel  sempre muito atenciosos  e prestáveis.
A localização foi excelente conseguimos estar no campo e ao mesmo tempo perto da cidade de Faro. cons: gostei de tudo portanto não tenho nada a apontar

A parte do Palácio é magnífica.
Pequeno-almoço e restaurante bons! E parabéns à(ao) doçeira bolos fabulosos! cons: penso que já precisa de uma remodelação nos quartos e nomeadamente a dos cortinados e blackouts.

hotelName: Pousada Palacio de Estoi – Small Luxury Hotels of the World
reviewText:
pros: O hotel está muito bem recuperado em que se nota claramente os extensos trabalhos que aí foram feitos resultando num espaço muito agradável e fazendo-nos sentir como uns verdadeiros príncipes e princesas num palácio de férias. Gostei da simpatia dos funcionários da receção com destaque para o Sr. Eusébio que nos fez sentir muito bem vindos. O pequeno almoço era adequado e completo. O quarto era bastante espaçoso e relativamente confortável. Gostei muito que tivessem arranjado um quarto com cama de casal conforme solicitado. A piscina era de tamanho adequado para o tamanho do hotel e bem localizada. Os jardins são muito bonitos bem cuidados. cons: Infelizmente existem alguns pontos a serem melhorados e vou ser um pouco mais extenso pois estamos a falar de um hotel de 5 estrelas pertencente ao Small Luxury Hotels of the World em que se espera nada mais do que excelência.
Um que salta logo à vista e que pessoalmente me incomoda bastante é o estado da limpeza/apresentação dos elevadores. Chegamos a um hotel muito bonito e assim que nos deslocamos para o quarto somos presenteados com um elevador muito pouco cuidado o que não ajuda em nada a experiência. Também as montras do piso 3 onde estão expostas peças com alguma relevância do hotel se nota que a limpeza não foi a mais correta sendo visível o vidro baço e com marcas do pano. Este desleixo estende-se à televisão de uma das salas nobres que toda a nossa estadia esteve sempre com marcas de sujidade e gordura. No dia anterior houve um evento e na manhã ainda eram visíveis vestígios tais como alguns copos e afins na zona do jardim.
O estado da limpeza da zona da piscina interior banho turco sauna e duche também não era das melhores notando-se algum desleixo nomeadamente nas marcas amareladas na parede da piscina ao nível da água. Agora o pior e que quero acreditar que foi um caso único foi a presença de baratas nesta zona da piscina interior. Ao estarmos a relaxar na piscina interior com os jactos de água a funcionar e uma família que também lá estava verificou a existência de duas baratas dentro de água o que levou a que saíssemos todos da piscina. De seguida fomos para o banho turco e aconteceu o mesmo. Esta situação foi imediatamente reportada a um dos responsáveis que nos justificou com uma desbaratização exterior.
Para concluir penso que seria mais simpático os funcionários receberem os hospedes no pequeno almoço com um "Bom dia" em vez de partirem do principio que somos todos estrangeiros e recebermos um "Good Morning".
